loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a male individual client, 46 years old, married and has nine children. He is a hardworking man who works 12 hours a day. He does brick laying in the rural areas, which he started in 1999 after noticing the mushrooming new buildings and therefore anticipated a high demand. He is well but is challenged with weather, especially the rainy season, which affects the quality of the bricks. He appreciates UGAFODE's support.

loans.use: To buy wood for burning bricks

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra, 46 years old, lives in a community in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has three children. Ra manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. She has been in this business for around twenty years and earns, on average, a daily income of US $5.

Ra wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, as there is none in her house now. She is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine so she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. Ra is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is an industrious mother from Mcarthur, Leyte. She is a 44-year-old woman with eight children, ages 24-3 years old. She engages in a fish vending business. She buys, at the same time sells, fish to the locals in her place. For almost 10 years now, she has engaged in the fish vending business.

She is asking for a loan to purchase a variety of  fresh fish to sell. In this way, she could continue manage her livelihood and be able to augment her income. She could now provide her growing children with nutritious meals and be able to send them to school.
  
She dreams that someday, she will be able to be successful in her chosen field, and to be sustainable as well.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fresh fish

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is from Ozamiz City. She and her husband has a farm land and earns a living doing farming activities. Recently, Perla availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer and hopes to yield more harvest. Perla deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, 58 years old, is married and has five children. Delia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Delia has been raising pigs for two years and has previously borrowed 5 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Marnie

texts.en:
Marnie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marnie is 20 years old and has one child who is in school.

Marnie has a business selling firewood in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more firewood to sell.

Marnie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marnie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Louwina

texts.en:
Louwina is 45 years old and married with one child who is in school. Louwina works very hard to provide for them.

Louwina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Louwina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other personal care products. 

In the future, Louwina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish.

Maria has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 58,  a widow in Tangub, she runs a store that primarily supports for her needs. Everyday she patiently tending her store.  Estrella is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her needs.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell

loans.name: Mary Vic

texts.en: Mary Vic is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of working to support her family. Recently,  Mary Vic requested a loan to purchase bags of of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income. Aside from her project of building concrete pig pens, she has thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale and plans to take in swine production for her business expansion. Someday  Mary Vic hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs; and building concrete pigpens

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en: Generosa, 51 years old, is from Tangub. Her husband is a wage earner but has no permanent work. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack vending. It began with selling a small amount of snacks to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in February of 2013. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies for 14,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store and to pay for additional raw ingredients for the food snack she makes and sale. She hopes that her business will continue, so that she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store and to pay for additional raw ingredients for the food snack she makes and sale

loans.name: Chren

texts.en:
Chren, 58 years old, is living in a community in Pursat Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farm that is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 30 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Jeziel

texts.en: Jeziel thought of good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could request financial assistance for her chosen business. Jeziel has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hogs. Jeziel wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. Someday, she hopes to repair her house, to provide her family a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her growing hogs

loans.name: Xiaoqiong

texts.en:
Xiaoqiong is a married woman with two children, 6 and 20 years old. One is attending school, and the other one is working. Her husband is working in another city. In addition, she has to take care of her older parents; her mother is blind without any ability to make a living.

She operates a bittern dishes stall in the market, a busy fruits and vegetables and foods market just outside her hometown. Due to it being a small town, in order to earn more money, she works every afternoon of the week from until night Monday to Sunday, but still makes a lower net income per month. She started the business in 2004 so that she could earn a living to support her family in these years.

Xiaoqiong requested 20,000 CNY from Microcred. She is taking this loan to stock up on meat and vegetables for her stall. Also, she wants to pay off her debt to relatives.

However, in winter, the temperature is very low; people don’t like to eat this kind of food, which made her business hard. She also spends a lot on transportation from the bigger source markets to her stall.

Her dream is to cure her mother's illness if she can save up enough money to do so. She is a very hardworking and honest lady.

loans.use: to stock up on meat and vegetables for her stall.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Johna works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing. Johna is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy supplies for her dried fish business.

Johna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy dried fish.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Rosalie is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Dúo Raquel De Santiago Group

texts.es:
Dúo Raquel de Santiago, integrado y representado por doña Claret, quien tiene dos hijos,es soltera
Doña Claret se dedica a la venta de consumo diario, atiende todos los días de lunes a domingo, ella vende golosinas, jugos, gaseosas, pastas, azúcar, granos, también vende poco de verduras como tomate, papa, zanahorias, y otros, ahora quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio que tiene frente a su tienda que es de frutas y quiere poner venta de granizadas, espera poder lograrlo ya que trabaja para sus dos hijos y darles educación.compra de productos comestibles y frutas.
texts.en: The Duo known as Raquel de Santiago includes and is represented by Claret.  She has two children and is single.  Claret works selling items for daily consumption.  She works all day Monday to Sunday.  She sells candies, juices, soft drinks, pasta, sugar, grains, and also vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, carrots and other items.  Now she wants to continue investing in her business by building on the location and adding items to the the front of her store, and that includes selling fruit. She wants to sell iced fruit beverages. She is hoping to be able to do this since she works for her two children in order to give them an education.  She will buy perishable goods and fruits.

loans.use: to buy perishable goods and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 37 years old and married with two children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Melanie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 50 years old and married with nine children.  With two of her children in school, Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rebecca has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a hardworking woman entrepreneur, with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like an internet cafe.

Rosario dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José Francisco es un pequeño productor de café en una comunidad de Jinotega. Vive con su esposa e hijo de 11 años, en su pequeña finca de 3.5 hectáreas, de las cuales 2.1 son de café.  En los últimos años, este productor ha venido mejorando su finca con la implementación de buenas prácticas agrícolas. Su cosecha de café promedio ha sido de 70 quintales pergamino, los cuales produce bajo los criterios de certificación comercio justo.

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permita garantizar un plan de manejo integrado de plagas y enfermedades en sus plantaciones. Esta inversión contribuirá a incrementar su producción de café en este ciclo, con lo cual mejorará los ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de este pequeño productor es ampliar el área de su finca, para dejarle a su hijo una finca más grande y productiva. Está seguro, que invirtiendo logrará una mayor productividad, y con ello mayores recursos para lograr su meta.
texts.en:
José Francisco is a small coffee producer in a community of Jinotega. He lives with his wife and 11-year-old son in his small farm of 3.5 hectares, 2.1 of which are coffee.  In the last years, this producer has been improving his farm with the implementation of good agricultural practices. His average coffee crop has been of 70 parchment quintals, which he produces under Fair Trade certification criteria.

For this cycle, he is requesting a loan for the purchase of inputs and fertilizers that enable him to guarantee an integrated pest and diseases management plan in his plantations. This investment will contribute to increase his coffee production in this cycle, with which he will improve the income for his family.

This small producer's dream is to expand his farm area so as to leave his son a bigger and more productive farm. He is sure that by investing, he will achieve a greater productivity and with it, greater resources to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy inputs and fertilizers that he will apply to his coffee plantation and ensure a good crop.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a native from Mcarthur, Leyte. She goes fishing and catches and sells fish. She is a 55-year-old woman, with three grown children. She has been engaged in fishing for almost 10 years. She faces financial problems that prevent her running her livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy fish foam (storage) and materials for fishing. These tools are very important in achieving more catch and being able to gain more earnings. She would be able to handle her income and pay her obligation.

Nenita is very glad that she availed the loan that will really improve her source of income.  She is determined to handle it properly for the improvement of the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish foam ( storage) and materials for fishing.

loans.name: Reah

texts.en:
Reah is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Reah is 38 years old and both of her children are in school.

Reah has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Reah requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like toys, slippers, school supplies and other home products.

Reah has been in this business for five years. In the future, Reah would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like toys, slippers, school supplies and other home products.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel works hard to support her family. Raquel is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy new a bundle of fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc.

Raquel has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Raquel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new bundle of fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Celia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fattening pigs. Celia is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Celia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines. Alma has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Alma has been in this business for five years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Alma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is a 51 year old, married woman, with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Victorina has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. Victorina requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more recycled materials for salel.

Victorina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Victorina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Gladdy

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Gladdy works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling slippers.  Gladdy is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Gladdy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mishe Mae

texts.en:
Mishe Mae is a 29 year old, married woman with two children, who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mishe Mae has a food production business in the Philippines. Mishe Mae requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Mishe Mae has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mishe Mae would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 42 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Violeta has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Violeta has been in this business for three years. In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

Alicia has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anadith

texts.en:
Anadith is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anadith is 40 years old and has three children who are in school. She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. 

Anadith has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of bananas to sell. She has been in this business for four years.  In the future, Anadith would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete her college degree.

loans.name: Wei

texts.en:
Wei, 28, is married and living with his wife and mother. He has been working caring for his sick mother for the last ten years. Due to the poor family situation, he started work at 18 years old. He and his wife got married 6 years ago, and they have a child, who is attending school. Her mother has taught them how to make bittern dishes (traditional Chinese herbal food/medicine) and helps them carry out this activity.

They bought a house in their hometown last year, and every month they need to pay the mortgage to the bank. It is a big expense, which causes them to have no spare money to do other things. 

He is asking MicroCred for a loan 20,000 CNY to stock up his business.

Wei and his wife have wanted to do home improvements for a long time now, but have invested their earnings in the education of their son and his mother’s illness.

With the loan, Wei hopes to improve their living standard; and also their family will be more comfortable. In the future, Wei hopes to continue to improve their life level little by little.

loans.use: to stock up his business

loans.name: Maritza Estella

texts.es:
Maritza de 40 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene tres hijos los cuales están estudiando es la escuela y dependen completamente de ella.

Oficios domésticos es la actividad a la cual Maritza se ha dedicado desde los nueve años, además hoy en día trabaja en un comedor de una amiga suya y lo ha hecho desde hace 3 años, es así como ha logrado salir adelante pues no le tiene miedo al trabajo.

Maritza es una mujer con propósitos, es por eso que necesita el crédito para montar su propio restaurante y comprar todo lo que necesita para llevarlo a cabo.


Ella sueña con que su restaurante funcione y lograr tener muchos clientes, para lo cual espera trabajar muy duro, pues piensa que sin esfuerzo no hay recompensa.
texts.en:
Maritza is 40 years old and lives with her partner.  She has three children who study in school and depend completely on her for support. 

She works as a maid and has been working in this field for 9 years.  She also works in a food stall run by a friend and she has been working there for 3 years.  In this was she has been able to get ahead, and she is not afraid of work. 

Maritza is a woman with a purpose.  For this reason she needs a loan. She plans to start her own food stall and to buy the things she needs to put the plan in motion.  

Her dream is for the food stall to work and to gain many customers.  She plans to work very hard.  She thinks that without effort there is no reward.

loans.use: to start her own food stall and to buy the things she needs to put the plan in motion.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Apolonia has been in this business for two years now. In the future, Apolonia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Letecia is 41 years old and both of her children are sent to school. She has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Letecia has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, purified water and other personal care products. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, purified water and other personal care products.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Imelda has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money in order to expand her business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Xiaochun

texts.en:
Xiaochun is a 31-year-old married man with 2 children aged between 5 and 9. They attend school. 

He has been operating a tire repair and sales shop since 2012 on the outskirts of the city. He started tire repair and sales there because he wanted to bring services closer to the people in the villages. 

Xiaochun has been able to make good sales and was able to send his children to school and build himself a decent house, since there is less competition in the area where he is located. 

Unfortunately, his mother was seriously ill, which cost him a lot of money. 

He requested 20,000 CNY from MicroCred so that he can replenish his tire repair and sales shop working capital which he drained recently, as he paid the school fees for his children. 

His main customers are the local community. He is affected mainly by the fluctuating prices of materials.
 
His dream is to expand the tire repair and sales shop.  If his working capital increases, then he can meet his customers' demand. 
He describes himself as very hard-working and his honesty has drawn many customers to him.

loans.use: to replenish working capital for his tire repair and sales shop.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 53 years old and married, with one child. 

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Emma has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Emma would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various fruits and veggies to sell at her fruit store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan which she will use as her working capital to buy more quantities of bananas, papaya, pineapple, coconut, squash and cabbage, among others which she sells at retail. More fruits and vegetables displayed on her stand will result in more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source with which to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Arceli hopes to buy a vehicle in the future, to easily deliver her products to her customers who buy in large quantities. She aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is 47 years old and lives in Tangub, Philippines. She is married with 4 school-age children. She is good in doing her farming activities and has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Lucila hopes to engage in a new business to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers and pesticides to get more produce

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 47 years old, married, and has one child.  She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Carmelita has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Carmelita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cecilia works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell lumber business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs.  

Cecilia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more lumber to sell for her buy-and-sell lumber business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and married with four children. All of her children are sent to school, and she works very hard to provide for them. Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other personal care products. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hazel is 43 years old and has two children who are in school.

Hazel has a purified drinking water business in the Philippines. Hazel requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Hazel has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Hazel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 44 years old, married with eight children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, etc.

Diosdada has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, etc

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en: Fedelina, after learning about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and hearing about all the the benefits and financial services, never hesitated to become a member. She has tried her luck by operating a business focused on her farming activities. Fedelina feels she owes her luck to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. She is now borrowing another loan to pay for seedlings and fertilizer. This will give her farming income a big boost. Fedelina is seeking better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is 64 years old who is very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and three children. He is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Juan wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and compost

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is hardworking father of three children.  Motorcycle transport is his source of income.  He rent the motorcycle 150PHP per day and he dream to own the motor so that he can save the daily rental of the motor.  Joseph become a member of Paglaum last year, and he is thankful because he can apply financial assistance of Paglaum to pay his motorcycle transport as down payment.  He hopes, someday he can own the motorcycle.

loans.use: to pay motorcycle transport

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida earns a livelihood by raising and selling hogs. She is a 48 year old married woman, with ten children.  Five of them are still attending school. It has been more than 10 years now that she has been engaged in raising hogs. 

She has requested a loan to buy pig feed and supplement. Nida would now able to raise quality hogs in the coming months. With these, she will be able to augment her earnings and able to handle her finances. She could now be able to provide the needs of her growing children, including quality education.

In the future, she dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplement

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is a supportive wife and mother of two children.  She support her husband from the income of her flower vending at the same time take care of her children.  She plan to increase her income by expanding her existing capital through the financial assistance offer the Paglaum.  Recently, she apply loan to buy fertilizer and compost to give her a big boost of income.   She hopes to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: At age of 65, Maria is very healthy and manage her sari-sari store. The income of her sari-sari store is enough to support her daily needs.   She is thankful to Paglaum because of the programs and services, trainings offer to their member she manage her sari-sari store very well.  Maria apply loan to Paglaum to buy materials for housing renovation, because she want to live in a comfortable house.  She hopes that her neighbor inspire by her, that age is not matter as long as you dream and fulfill.

loans.use: to buy materials for housing renovation

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling salted eggs.  Elena is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 35 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Altia

texts.en:
Altia is 37 years old and married with two children.  With two children in school, Altia works very hard to provide for them.

Altia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Altia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Altia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 43 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 51 years old and has two children, both of whom are in school. She is married.

Nida is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nida has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 53 years old and married, with seven children.  With three children in school, Elisa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Elisa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, spices and other groceries. 

In the future Elisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Santiaga works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Santiaga is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc.s for her food vending business.

Santiaga has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Tatiana Del

texts.es:
Tatiana es una mujer de treinta y ocho años de edad, que decidió emprender un negocio de pulpería para poder brindarle apoyo a su esposo en el sustento de su familia. Ella es madre de dos adolescentes, los cuales son su principal ayuda en el negocio, donde ofrece a los clientes, refrescos naturales, gaseosas, golosinas y frituras. 
Esta mujer, es un ejemplo de perseverancia, día a día lucha para que su tienda crezca, en estos momentos ella solicita la ayuda de Kiva y MiCrédito para que le brinden un préstamo que le permita comprar frutas, golosinas, gaseosas y productos de uso personal al por mayor ya que son muy demandados por sus clientes y así tener mejores ganancias. En un futuro ella desea tener un minisúper que ofrezca una variedad de productos del uso cotidiano.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a 38 year old woman who decided to undertake a grocery store business in order to be able to help her husband support their family.  She has two adolescent children, and they are her main help in the business.  She offers her customers natural soft drinks, soft drinks, candy, and fried snacks.

This woman is an example of perseverance.  She struggles day to day so that her store will grow.  She is now requesting help from Kiva and MiCrédito to get a loan that will allow her to buy fruit, candy, soft drinks, and personal use products wholesale.  They are very much in demand by her customers.  This way she will have better earnings.

In the future she wishes to have a mini-supermarket that offers a variety of daily use products.

loans.use: to buy fruit, candy, soft drinks, and personal use products wholesale.

loans.name: Dorianela

texts.es:
Dorianela, es una mujer fuerte y decidida, que a sus treinta años de edad, trabaja cada día para sacar adelante su negocio de venta de tortillas. Desde los diez años de edad ella aprendió a moler el maíz, preparar la masa y palmear las tortillas puestas en el fuego, su madre quien la impulso en este negocio, siempre ha sido su gran apoyo. 
En estos momentos, Dorianela,requiere de un prestamo para que se le beneficie, y para poder comprar sacos de maíz y así asegurar su producción. Desde que trabaja con Kiva y MiCrédito ha aprendido a ahorrar y responsabilizarse con sus compromisos. Ella espera siempre seguir trabajando con préstamos para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dorianela is a strong and determined woman. She is 30 years old, and she works every day to move her tortilla sale business forward. At the age of 10, she learned how to grind corn, prepare the dough, flatten the tortillas, and put them on the fire. Her mother pushed her to start this business, and she has always been her greatest supporter.

Currently, Dorianela is requesting a loan that will benefit her. She will use it to buy sacks of corn in order to guarantee her production. Since she started working with Kiva and MiCredito, she has learned how to save and how to be responsible with her commitments. She hopes to continue working with loans always so that she can move forward.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en: Ethel is a mother of three children and supportive wife of butcher.  She engage in vegetable vending display in market.  Her children help her during non school days, and because of the trainings services offer by Paglaum to her she survive the competency in the market.  Later on, she realize to increase the display of her store by purchasing  variety of food continents and spices to meet the demand of the customer,and because of the demand, she apply loan to Paglaum in order to buy variety of food continents and spices for additional sales at the same time income.  The profit she earn from her business well save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy  spices and vegetable for retail

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita is a grocery vendor for 10 years.  Her passion in business help her support her family of their daily needs.  Jovita is a member of Paglaum for 2 years, because of the programs and services offer to member, especially in trainings aspect, her business whose up and down become steady.  She apply loan to Paglaum in order to expand her business by purchasing bulk of firewood and charcoal, and display at the corner of her grocery store.  She hopes that someday, she own delivery truck for firewood and charcoal.

loans.use: to buy bulk of firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: Perseverance is a secret tool of Dionesia to survive in fish selling business.  She is thankful for the training of Paglaum, because its help her to manage her business well.  She apply additional loan in Paglaum to increase her capital of fish selling.  Over supply of fish, is another opportunity for her to engage in dried fish for additional income.   She hopes and pray that her business well progress continually.

loans.use: to buy additional bulk of fish

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en: Genelita is a farmer from Mabini, Baliangao who grows root crops and various commodities. She is requesting a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. Genelita hopes to have a good yield so that she can save for the education of her two children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Ma. Benjie

texts.en: Ma. Benjie has a piece of agricultural land in Bagacay, Sibutad. She root crops and coconut and earns well for her family. She is thankful that Paglaum MPC has been her constant financing partner for her farming activities. Now, she applied for a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. Ma. Benjie hopes to have a good yield so that she can save for emergencies.

loans.use: to pay labor for land preparation and seedlings

loans.name: Deonila

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Deonila works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Deonila is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Deonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nepthalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Nepthalie works hard to support her family.

She has a hollow-blocks (cement) making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hardware.  Nepthalie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her hollow blocks making business.

Nepthalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her hollow blocks making.

loans.name: Flores Marie

texts.en:
Flores Marie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory of vegetables. Flores Marie has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Flores Marie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 47 years old, married with two children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gemma has borrowed and paid 31 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Gemma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marila

texts.en:
Marila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Marila has been in this business for 3 years. Marila earns more income from buying and selling fish and raising livestock.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Pedro Efraín

texts.es:
Pedro de 39 años de edad, está casado y sus dos hijos estudian educación básica.


Desde sus 14 años, Pedro se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura, y ha sido su mayor fuente de ingresos económicos durante años.

Este crédito lo está solicitando para comprar los materiales necesarios para preparar la tierra donde va a sembrar maíz.

Pedro Sueña con cultivar hortalizas ya que  su padre le enseñó como hacerlo y por supuesto ayudar a sus hijos a que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 39, is married and has two children who go to school.

Pedro has worked in agriculture for 14 years.  It has been his greatest source of income for years.

He is requesting this loan to buy the materials needed to prepare the land where he will plant corn.

Pedro dreams of growing vegetables because his father taught him how to do so.  Of course, he also dreams of helping his children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to prepare the land where he will plant corn.

loans.name: Neriza

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Neriza works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Neriza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Neriza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 53 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lucila has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lucila requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lucila has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Lucila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Myra  works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling corn. Myra  is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her food vending business.

Myra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Germalina

texts.en:
Germalina works hard to support her family. Germalina is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Germalina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Germalina has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Germalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores is 49 years old, married with eight children.

Ma. Dolores works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Ma. Dolores has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Ma. Dolores aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kathleen

texts.en:
Kathleen is 30 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Kathleen works very hard to provide for them.

Kathleen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, detergent, soap, toothpaste, candies, etc. to sell.

Kathleen has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Kathleen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, detergent, soap, toothpaste, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
Argie is 44 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Argie is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Argie has been in pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 42 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school, Nora  works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like can goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Nora has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like can goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Rubelie

texts.en:
Rubelie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rubelie is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rubelie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rubelie requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Rubelie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rubelie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
Rosa de 38 años de edad, es madre soltera pero ella trabaja para darle lo necesario a sus hijos.
 
Rosa posee una tienda, ya tiene 5 años con su negocio, por lo tanto cuenta con la experiencia necesaria para vender y atender a sus clientes.


Este crédito lo está solicitando para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, consomés, bebidas, golosinas, fardos de jabón, etc. para surtir su tienda.
 
Ella piensa que la vida se forma a base de propósitos, es por ello que está dispuesta a lograr sus objetivos y entre ellos está mantener activa su tienda y darle todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 38, is a single mother.  However, she works to give her children what they need.

Rosa has a store.  She has had her business for five years.  Therefore she has the experience needed to sell and tend to her customers.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy rice, beans, sugar, consomme, drinks, candy, and bundles of soap, etc. in order to stock her store.

She thinks that life is shaped by goals.  That is why she is prepared to achieve her objectives.  Among her objectives is keeping her store active and giving her children everything they need.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, consomme, drinks, candy, and bundles of soap, etc. in order to stock her store and to buy medicine for her father.

loans.name: Piñaport

texts.en:
Forty-three year old Piñaport hails in Mcarthur, Leyte. She is a married woman with eight children ages 19-3 years respectively. Her husband earns a living as a carpenter. For 10 years she has engaged in the hog raising business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and supplement.  These will enables Piñaport to continue to maintain her hog raising livelihood. In this way she can raise quality hogs and that will help augment her income. Thus, she could provide her family with a healthy diet and good living conditions.

Piñaport would like to expand her business to make it more productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplement

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Josephine has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Josephine has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a jewelry repair shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional tools for her business.

Amparo has been in this business for 2 years. Amparo earns more income from buying and selling jewelry.

Amparo has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional tools for her business

loans.name: Eliseo Del Carmen

texts.es:
Eliseo es un productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Tiene 30 años y vive con su esposa quien le apoya en las actividades de la finca. 

El siempre ha tenido un espíritu de superación, y aunque solo pudo estudiar hasta el segundo grado de primaria por las limitaciones económicas de su familia, con su trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado tener una pequeña finca de 2.1 hectáreas, la cual está certificada por comercio justo y UTZ. 

Su integración en estos procesos de certificación evidencia la implementación de las buenas prácticas en los aspectos productivos, sociales y ambientales en su finca, que han derivado en el mejoramiento de los rendimientos productivos en los últimos años, donde también ha tenido desafíos siendo el principal las plagas y enfermedades que afectan el café.

Para este ciclo, Eliseo está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le ayuden a garantizar las condiciones que requiere su cafetal para asegurar una buena cosecha y con ello mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. 

Este pequeño productor, asegura que el café es un rubro rentable, y que con su dedicación y disciplina en el trabajo, podrá continuar mejorando las condiciones de su familia con los ingresos que obtenga de su finca.
texts.en:
Eliseo is a coffee producer in north Nicaragua. He is 30 years old and lives with his wife who helps him with the farm.

He has always had a spirit of excellence. Although he was able to study only until the second grade due to the economic constraints of his family, his work and effort earned him a small farm of 2.1 hectares. His farm is certified by Fair Trade and UTZ.

Integration into the certification processes demonstrates the implementation of best practices in production as well as social and environmental aspects of his farm. This has led to improved yield in recent years despite the challenges of pests and diseases that affect the coffee.

For this round, Eliseo requests a loan to purchase inputs and fertilizers to help ensure the conditions required for a guaranteed good harvest. This leads to higher income for the well-being of his family.

This small producer assures that coffee is a profitable industry. With dedication and discipline, he can continue to improve the conditions of his family with the income from his farm.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and fertilizers necessary for his coffee plantation and guaranteed good harvest.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 32 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Sheila is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Sheila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Sheila has been in the pig fattening business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sheila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Norlita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from weaving bamboo.  Norlita is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to resell.

Norlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to resell

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Charlene is 46 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Charlene has a food vending business in the Philippines. Charlene requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

Charlene has been in this business for 8 years. In the future Charlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 46 years old and has six children. Imelda is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Imelda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Imelda has been raising livestock for 6 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe works hard to support herself. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Fe requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years now and also earns additional income from food vending.

In the future Ma. Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Santos Eduardo

texts.es:
Santos tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su hermana y sobrinos y trabaja para salir adelante.


En la zona donde él vive es muy común la comercialización de ganado, es por eso que Santos se dedica a esta actividad la cual aprendió de su padre.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar cuatro novillas de repasto para criarlas y venderlas dentro de un año y así obtener ganancias.

Santos sueña con tener un establo donde resguardar sus animales y además espera viajar a EE.UU. para reencontrarse con su hijo ya que tiene mucho tiempo de no verlo.
texts.en:
Santos is 52 years old and lives with his sister and her children.  He works to get ahead.  In the area where he lives, it is very common to sell livestock.  Santos does this work, which he learned from his father.

He needs this loan to purchase four grass-fed heifers to raise them and sell them in a year to earn a profit.  

Santos dreams of having a stable where he can shelter his animals.  He also hopes of traveling to the United States to spend time with his son again since it has been a long time since they have seen each other.

loans.use: to purchase four grass-fed heifers to raise and sell them in a year to earn a profit.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is 43 years old. She is a farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past eight years. Arevik lives with her husband and eight year old son, David. 
Arevik's husband helps her with selling the gathered harvest in the bazaar that brings income to the family. 
Over the years both Arevik and her husband gained enough skills and experience to run the business. They chose this crop business because it is profitable; fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. The requested loan is very important for them, because they need to purchase pesticide for the grape orchard and fertilizer needed for the farm. 
 As this is Arevik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative almost 500 borrowers like Arevik get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses.
Assuring responsible monthly payments of the loan, Arevik and her husband hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for pesticide for the grape orchard and fertilizer needed for the farm

loans.name: Dúo Shalom De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Shalom de San Bartolo
Este dúo está formado por don Rubén Alfonso, él tiene 34 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de consumo diario, como golosinas, yogurt, cereal, leche, queso, frijoles volteados, verduras en general, arroz, pastas, papel higiénico, dulces, aguas gaseosas, el está solicitando el crédito para surtir su tienda de consumo diario ubicado en la calle principal de San Bartolomé Milpas Altas, su propósito es comprar abarrotes como arroz, frijol, aceite y aguas gaseosas,espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Shalom Duet from San Bartolo.
This duet is formed by Mr. Ruben Alfonso, who is 34 years old.  He works selling basic need products such a candy, yogurt, cereal, milk, cheese, refried beans, vegetables in general, rice, pastas, toilette paper, sweets, soda beverages. He is asking for a loan to supply his grocery store located in the main street of San Bartolome Milpas Altas. His goal is to buy groceries such as rice, beans, oil and soda beverages. He hopes that he can be helped with the requested loan.

loans.use: To buy edible products for resale.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida raises and sells hogs to earn a living.  She is a 30 year old woman, with four children, ages 12-5 year old respectively.

She is asking a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy pig feed and supplement. These will really improve the quality of hogs she raises and it enables her to boost her livelihood as well.  With these, Nida could prepare healthy food for her family and be able to continue financing the schooling of her children.

Nida is very glad to have the loan,and she is determined to expand her business for the welfare of her growing children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplement

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a selling rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Pacita has been in this business for 4 years. Pacita earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: Renet

texts.en:
Renet works hard to support four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Renet requested a PHP 6750 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Renet is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 53 years old, married with six children.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Victoria has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Victoria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 40 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Elisa works very hard to provide for them.

Elisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, home product care and other groceries.

Elisa has been in this business for 5 years now. 

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus cinco hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, bebida típica de la región que se obtiene de la caña de azúcar, realiza esta actividad desde hace 11 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de nuevas herramientas para la destilación de aguardiente así como para brindar mantenimiento a sus herramientas actuales, con esto el tendrá mayores facilidades para destilar su aguardiente y mejorará su nivel de ventas y sus ingresos lo que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rene, 55, lives with his wife and his five children in the district of Callayuc, a community dedicated to agriculture and ranching which is located in the region of Cajamarca of the northern mountains of Peru.
He makes a living from the distillation of aguardiente (brandy), a typical drink of the region which is made from sugar cane.  He has been doing this work for 11 years because of which he has experience in this business and good personal and work references in the district.  He will use the loan to buy new tools for the distillation of aguardiente as well as to maintain his current tools.  With this, it will be easier to distill his aguardiente and it will improve his level of sales and income which will permit him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new tools for the distillation of aguardiente as well as to maintain his current tools.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling corn.  Rosa is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fruits to sell for her buy and sell fruits business.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fruit to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Lilia has been in this business for 3 years now.

Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe works hard to support her family. Phoebe is married and has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Phoebe requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Phoebe has been in this business for 8 years now.

Phoebe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma.Teresa is 50 years old and married with two children. Ma.Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Ma.Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, sugar, eggs, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for 20 years now. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, sugar, eggs, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
Selma works hard to support her family. Selma is married and has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell.

Selma has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Selma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Marvin Fidencio

texts.es:
Marvin de 26 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, dejó sus estudios para ayudar a su padre, ahora está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 3 hijos pero solo dos estudian en la escuela pues el otro está muy pequeño.

Marvin se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado, el lugar donde trabaja está a media hora de su casa, su esposa le ayuda en el cuido del ganado mientras él trabaja en la agricultura.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar insumos para sembrar granos básicos y para comprar ganado.

Sus sueños son que sus hijos salgan adelante, que sean personas con valores, además espera hacer mejoras a su casa pues considera que toda persona merece un hogar digno.
texts.en:
Marvin is 26 years old.  He attended school through sixth grade and left school to help his father.  Now, he is married and his wife takes care of the domestic duties.  They have three children.  Two of them attend school and the third is still too young.

Marvin works planting basic grains and raising livestock.  The place where he works is located half an hour from his home.  His wife helps him to care for the livestock while he farms.

He needs this loan to purchase supplies to plant basic grains and to purchase livestock.  His dreams are that his children succeed and that they are people with values, and he hopes to make repairs to his home because he thinks everyone deserves a safe, dignified place to live.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to plant basic grains and to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una pequeña productora de café de 43 años de edad. Vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en la zona norte de Nicaragua. Cuenta con una finca de 7 hectáreas, de las cuales 5 aproximadamente son de café, siendo éste la principal fuente de ingresos para su familia.

En los últimos 7 años, Virginia ha logrado integrarse a los procesos de certificación de comercio juto, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices, a través la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC).

Para este ciclo, el objetivo de esta emprendedora es incrementar la productividad de su cafetal, y obtener más de 160 quintales de café pergamino. Para lograrlo, está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita comprar los fertilizantes que requiere su plantación, y garantizar las aplicaciones con las dosis completas, para que las plantas puedan asimilar y dar mejores resultados. 

Su pasión por el trabajo y por salir adelante con sus hijos, es algo que siempre ha caracterizado a Virginia; te animamos a apoyarla en el logro de sus metas, en particular la de mejorar sus ingresos, a través del incremento en la producción y calidad de su café para este año.
texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years old and a small-scale coffee grower. She lives with her husband and their five children in northern Nicaragua. She has a farm of 7 hectares of which 5 are for coffee production. Coffee is the main source of income for her family.

In the last seven years, Virginia has successfully obtained Fair Trade Certification, UTZ and C.A.F.E Practices through the Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria [People in Community Action] Association.

For this round, the objective of this entrepreneur is to increase the productivity of coffee and to obtain more than 160 quintals of parchment coffee. In order to achieve this, she requests a loan to buy fertilizers necessary for planting and ensure that it is applied in full doses so that the coffee plants can absorb the fertilizer and produce more coffee.

Virginia has always stood out because of her passion for her work and for improving her children's lives. We encourage you to support her in achieving her goals, especially to improve her income through increased production and the coffee quality for this year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers necessary for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Zebogul

texts.en: Zebogul is a young woman, who is 28 years old. She is a sociable and hardworking woman. She lives with her parents, sister and two sons in the city of Kulob. Her elder son is 3 and the younger is 2 years old. Zebogul does not have higher education. She has engaged in agriculture for 3 years. This kind of activity is the main source of income for her and her family. The aim of getting loan is that Zebogul wants to buy potato seed, mineral fertilizer and plant crops. Her main problem is lack of money, but Zebogul believes that with the help of Kiva and its lenders she will be able to solve her problem. She thanks you in advance!

loans.use: To buy potato seed, mineral fertilizer and plant crops.

loans.name: Suzel

texts.en:
Suzel works hard to support her family. Suzel is married and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Suzel has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future Suzel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins needed for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is married and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta, Philippines. Samuel is a fisherman, he manages his fishing business and owns fish cages as well.
