He earns a good income each month doing this type of work, supporting the needs of his big family, especially his children's education until they graduated and got their own jobs. Samuel has requested a loan of 45,000 PHP to purchase 100 liters of diesel gasoline, paints and epoxy, and pay for fishing boat engine repair. In the future, Samuel hopes to buy another fishing boat to improve and expand her fishing business. He also wishes to arrange a decent home for all of those in the family.

loans.use: to purchase 100 liters of diesel gasoline, paints and epoxy, and pay for fishing boat engine repair

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa propia con 2 hijos a su cargo en el distrito de Oyotún en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú, este distrito se dedica a las labores agrícolas, a la compra y venta de animales de corral y al comercio de abarrotes.

El se dedica a la compra y venta de panca que es un alimento para cuyes, cuenta con una motocarguera con la cual reparte su producto a sus diversos clientes, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos y reparaciones a su moto carguera ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, esto le servirá para poder repartir de una mejor manera su producto a sus clientes lo que tendrá gran influencia en su negocio y le generará mayores ingresos permitiendole mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 41, lives in his own house with the two children he raises in the district of Oyotun in the province of Chiclayo of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.  The people in this district make a living from agricultural labor; the buying and selling of farm animals; and commerce in vegetables.
He makes a living from the buying and selling of corn husks which is feed for guinea pigs.  He has a delivery vehicle with which he distributes his product to his various customers.  He has five years of experience in the business and has good personal and work references in his district.  He is requesting a loan to repair his delivery vehicle which is in bad condition currently.  This will permit him to distribute his product in a better way to his customers and he will generate better income which will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to repair his delivery vehicle which is in bad condition currently.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 51 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Cecilia has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Charlieta

texts.en:
Charlieta lives with her daughter, her son-in-law and their two children. At the age of 61, she is at the head of a flourishing sewing workshop that she wishes to develop even more.

In 1990, Charlieta’s husband gave her 20,000 pesos to open a sari-sari store. She preferred however to spend the money on a second-hand sewing machine and some materials for sewing. She sold her first products, in particular, curtains, to her neighbors and friends. The quality of her work was such that her reputation spread and she gathered more customers.

Together with a series of loans, she bought materials for her sewing business. Today Charlieta makes curtains, bed sheets, blouses, polo shirts, shorts and is still expanding her line.

Charlieta employs 8 sewers and twelve sewing machine. She now wants to help three other neighbors who are very motivated to earn and with more orders coming at her doors, she needed capital to accommodate them all.

Charlieta is now requesting a loan amounting to PhP 100,000 to buy 400 yards of assorted cloth fabric, 100 yards of silver cloth design, 2 rolls of tussle ring for curtains, 100 yards cloth for seat covers, lace fabric for curtains, etc. to be made into curtains and seat covers, since these are in demand orders by her customers.

Charlieta wants to buy a hand cart for one of her helpers with a handicapped child. This will enable the neighbor not only to move the merchandise around more easily, but also and above all, her son. Truly, Charlieta is one of the partners who are mindful not only in improving her business and her family, but in looking after her own community.

loans.use: To buy 400 yards of assorted fabric, 100 yards of silver fabric design, 2 rolls of tussle ring, 100 yards cloth fabric, lace fabric to be made into curtains and seat cover

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es:
José de 29 años de edad, pudo estudiar hasta 5° grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 2 hijos que aún no tienen la edad  para comenzar la escuela.


José es una persona trabajadora, él se levanta desde muy temprano a tomar su desayuno para luego salir a preparar la tierra donde cultiva maíz y frijol, estas actividades las aprendió de su padre quien también es agricultor, la distancia que tiene que caminar para ir a su trabajo es de 10 minutos lo cual es una ventaja porque le queda cerca.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar los insumos para sembrar maíz y frijol, terminar de preparar la tierra y comprar un chivo.

Su sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos, que sean profesionales y con las ganancias de su cultivo espera sembrar más para aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
Jose is 29 years old, and he studied until the 5th grade. He is in a common-law marriage and his wife is dedicated to the household chores. He has two children that are still not old enough to start school.

Jose is a hard worker. He gets up very early to eat breakfast and then leaves to prepare the ground where he grows corn and beans. He learned these jobs from his father who was also a farmer. The distance that he has to walk to get to his work is about 10 minutes, which is an advantage because it is close.

He is requesting this loan to buy the supplies to plant corn and beans, finish preparing the ground, and to buy a goat. His dream is to move his children ahead so they can be professionals, and with the earnings from his farming he hopes to plant more in order to increase his production.

loans.use: to buy the supplies to plant corn and beans, finish preparing the ground, and to buy a goat.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Ana Mercedes de 38 años de edad y posee 3 hijos pequeños se dedica desde hace 4 años a la serigrafía con su esposo (Elaboración de figuras en playeras, gorras, camisetas etc.) ella solicita nuevamente una crédito para la compra de 10 botes de pintura ya que es mejor por mayor porque actualmente ella compra botecillos y no le rinde más de una semana ya que son muy caros, ella está muy agradecida con el apoyo que se le ha brindado ya que actualmente ya tienen más producción en su negocio y han podido ampliar mas su producción y obtener más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Ana Mercedes, 38, has three small children. For the past 4 years, she's worked at screenprinting with her husband (the making of figures on t-shirts, hats, shirts, etc). She is applying for a loan again for the purchase of 10 buckets of paint which is better in bulk. Currently, she buys little bottles and it doesn't last her more than a week; they are very expensive. She's very thankful for the support that you've provided her since currently they already have more production in her business and they've been able to grow their production more and obtain more income for their family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make logos.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is a strong woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is living in a small town, where culture and traditions are most used by residents. She is married and has four children.

Malika has 25 years experience of doing business and feeding her family. She tries to ensure her family needs nothing. 

She has a business of sewing traditional women's dresses. Additionally she has an activity making a thread from wool. It is their traditonal activity and she also passed on this tradition to her children. 

Malika is a strong, responsible and honest person. She hopes to have good conditions and a place for her activity. She is planning to renovate her room and asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy construction supplies. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Davlatmo

texts.en:
Davlatmo is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1979. She is living in a small village with her family.  She is married and has six children. They have a big family and her husband works in Russia in order to earn money and feed their family.

She had many years of practice doing business. She has an activity in agriculture; she plants cereals like wheat, corn and cotton. First her activity was in rented land, and then she had her own collective farm. In her free time she sews traditional women's dresses for additional income to feed her family. 

She is planning to process her land for the coming season and buy seeds and fertilizer. She asks a loan from Kiva lenders to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Hog raising has been Marlon's business. He has operated this kind of business for 10 years.

Marlon would like to provide his hogs with proper nutrition, but he doesn't have enough capital.

With regards to his situation, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000. He will use this loan to buy vaccines, feed and vitamins.

He knows that having this loan amount will enable him to maintain his hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feed and vitamins for his hogs

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.en:
Shamigul is a skillful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1978. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a master; he repairs and renovates houses and works seasonally. 

She has experience of buying and selling spare parts from 1997 to 2007. In 2007 she changed her activity to buying and selling textiles and kids clothing. She well knows her business and has permanent clients. 

She appealed to IMON and asks a loan to buy a new assortment of clothing for the coming season. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness. 

She hopes to have more clients and earn money for the family needs.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothing for the coming season

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto runs a videoke house.  He earns a living by the rent he charges for a certain period of time. He is 56 years old man, with two dependents. His youngest child is 10. He has been running a videoke house for 10 years now.
 
Alberto is asking for a loan to purchase an additional videoke set and pay for maintenance. This way, he could continue to operate his business and is able to serve his customers again. Thus, it will eventually improve his earnings and handle he finances.
 
Alberto is thankful for the funds he receives  He would like to manage it properly for sustainable living.

loans.use: to purchase an additional videoke set and pay for maintenance

loans.name: Perina

texts.en:
Perina is thankful that she was granted a 19,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living needs. 

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan which she will use as her part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like canned goods, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods etc. which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Perina plans to expand and have a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education to allow them better opportunities in life and see them become professionals someday. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is 60 years old and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She sells bananas to earn a living and had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more bananas to sell. Thelma has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for banana

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en: Crisanto is 52 years old living at Ugac Norte with his family. He manages a retail store for income. In his store, he sells grocery items and snacks. He is diligent in gaining income for the sustenance of his family. Crisanto wanted to buy more grocery items but had insufficient fund that is why he is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy more grocery items to sell such as canned goods, softdrinks and breads to sell. He hopes to meet all his customers demand for affordable and good quality of sales.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell such as canned goods, softdrinks and breads to sell

loans.name: Jessiry

texts.en:
Jessiry is 49 years old, married with three children.

Jessiry works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Jessiry has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jessiry aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 57 years old, married and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially in savings mobilization and financial management.

She owns a general retail shop where she sells household commodities like sugar, salt, tea leaves, soap, and cooking fat, among others. Jane is borrowing from Kiva to buy more household commodities, e.g., sugar, salt, tea leaves and cooking fat, and hence add stock to her general retail shop for increased income.
 
She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more household commodities, e.g., sugar, salt, tea leaves and cooking fat, to add stock to her general retail shop for increased income.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 49 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, canned goods, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Cecilia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is 55 years old, a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Geronima has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. Geronima requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more coffee, milk and sugar for her cafeteria.

Geronima has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, milk and sugar for her cafeteria

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 44 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Delma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Delma has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 52 years old and married.

Merlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocsk of groceries to sell.

Merlyn has been in this business for thirty years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Merlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocsk of groceries to sell

loans.name: Idimo

texts.en:
Idimo is a conscientious woman. She is 61 years old and lives with her family in the district of Muminobod. Idimo and her husband are pensioners. Her son is migrant worker in Russia, and her daughters are involved in sewing. 

Idimo is a professional dressmaker. She learned this activity from her mother and taught her daughters. 

Idimo plans to renovate her home. Their pension and profit from the activities is insufficient for them to renovate the house. For this reason, Idimo applied for a loan. She promises to repay the loan on time. Idimo hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 49 years old, married and has five children. To help her husband for a living she is engaged in a rice production business. She needs financial assistance to pay for the labor cost of planting her rice field to start another crop of rice.

Jocelyn plans for the future to expand her business in rice production to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To pay for labor cost for planting the rice field.

loans.name: Aris

texts.en: Aris is 24 years old and married with one child. He has managed his transportation and hog-raising business for three years. He aims to improve the growth of his hogs but his capital is not enough to sustain their daily maintenance. For this reason, he is seeking for financial assistance of PHP 25,000. He will use this loan amount to buy essential vitamins and hog feed.

loans.use: to buy essential vitamins and feeds for his hogs

loans.name: Ganny

texts.en:
Ganny hails from the town of Dulag, Leyte. She is a 39-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest is 16 and the youngest is 2. She engages in fishing. She sells fish to earn a living. Aside from fishing, she also raises and sells hogs as supplemental income.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and pig feed.  These would really improve the quality of hogs she raises and also augment her ongoing catch. Thus, Ganny's earnings will increase and she will be able to settle her obligations. In the long run, she could be able to provide her family with nutritious diets.
 
Ganny is eager to expand her business for the welfare of her growing children and also for the improvement of the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and pig feed

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlyn is 32 years old and has one child who is in school.

Merlyn has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Merlyn requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Merlyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 23 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Mary Ann has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 43 years old and has two children ages 13 and 14 years old.

Her husband, in order to provide for their family, works as a cook abroad.

Ma. Luisa started her business of wholesale soft drinks delivery using their savings of PHP 30,000 in order to help her husband with their expenses and save up for the schooling of their children in college. She started to take orders from small stores and delivered soft drinks to them that she purchased from the manufacturer. At first she delivered them herself using a customized motorbike until her business become stable with regular customers and net earnings of PHP 10,000 a month, enabling her to hire one helper to deliver her soft drinks. Together with good management and hard work, her business grows. 

Ma. Luisa shares her blessing through social service in their community. She supports a women for livelihood program in their area which sews rugs for a living through linking with suppliers and buyers. She also supports the youth community programs through scholarships.

Today, Ma. Luisa now has eight workers delivering her soft drinks in a wider area in their community as well as nearby towns and is now earning a net of PHP 35,000 monthly with more orders from her growing customers. Ma. Luisa needed capital to expand her business of wholesale soft drinks delivery and add another storeroom for her soft drinks.

Ma. Luisa is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 80,000 to buy 1,000 cases of soft drinks to be delivered to her customers. 

Ma. Luisa wanted to expand her business to create more employment in the community as well as provide a better future for her children until such time her husband does not need to go abroad and will be with them.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 cases of soft drinks to be delivered to her customers.

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from training, especially enterprise development and financial management. She is 35 years old and blessed with two children who are both still attending school. 

She operates a green grocery store selling assorted fruits and vegetables. She also has a beauty salon. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy assorted fruits and vegetables, e.g. onions, spinach, tomatoes and mangoes, to add stock to her grocery shop.

She is happy with Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy assorted fruits and vegetables, e.g., onions, spinach, tomatoes and mangoes to add stock to her grocery shop.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José, de 43 años de edad, es agricultor, por motivos de la guerra interna que sufrio nuestro pais, no pudo continuar estudiando, está acompañado y junto con su pareja tienen 6 hijos de 22, 20, 18, 16, 7 y 4 años de edad, de los cuales 3 trabajan para ayudarle a sus padres económicamente y los otros 3 aun se encuentran estudiando en el centro educativo de la comunidad, su pareja se dedica a la venta de pupusas en la comunidad.

José, se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y a la siembra de hortalizas desde hace más de 25 años, siembra maíz, frijoles, tomates, rábanos, pepinos, pipianes etc. Todo lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes siempre se han dedicado a este negocio; para trasladarse a su trabajo José, tiene que caminar 4 kilómetros todos los días, trabaja en el horario de 6:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m..

José, está solicitando el crédito a CREDICAMPO para comprar insumos agrícola para cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 10,500 metros cuadrados de frijol, y de esa manera asegurar los ingresos para asegurar la sostenibilidad de su familia y así poder darle una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Elías, es lograr tener ganancias de su trabajo para poder ahorrar y mejorar su vivienda; también sueña con aumentar su hato ganadero, para obtener un poco más de ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose, 43, is a farmer.  Because of the internal war which our country endured, he was not able to continue studying.  He is married and with his wife has six children, 22, 20, 18, 16, 7, and 4 years old, of which three work to help their parents economically and the other three are studying in the education center of the community.  His wife makes a living selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas) in the community.
Jose has been making a living from agriculture, ranching, and the cultivation of vegetables for more than 25 years.  He plants corn, beans, tomatoes, radishes, cucumbers, squash, etc.  He learned all of this from his parents who have always made a living in this business.  In order to get to his work, Jose has to walk four kilometers every day.  He works from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.
Jose is requesting a loan from CrediCampo to buy agricultural supplies in order to cultivate 21,000 square meters of corn and 10,500 square meters of beans and in this way insure the income to guarantee the sustainability of his family and thus be able to give them a better quality of life.
Jose's dream is to have earnings from his work in order to be able to save and improve his residence.  He also dreams of increasing his herd of livestock in order to obtain more earnings.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to cultivate 21,000 square meters of corn and 10,500 square meters of beans.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo de 46 años de edad, no posee ningún tipo de nivel académico, actualmente está acompañado  y tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo una vive junto a él y los demás ya son personas independientes, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también de vez en cuanto ayuda a su pareja a trabajar en la agricultura.

Arturo es agricultor, desde muy niño su padre le enseñó como realizar los trabajos agrícolas tales como siembra de maíz frijol y jícama, actualmente trabaja dos hectáreas de jícama y también una de frijol.

El dinero de este crédito será invertido para pagar alquiler de la tierra que cultiva y para comprar insumos.

Su propósito es poder trabajar y tener éxito en sus cultivos y sabe que con su esfuerzo y la ayuda de los créditos podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Arturo is 46 years old, and he does not have any type of formal education. He is currently in a common-law marriage and has three children. Only one of them lives with him, and the others are already independent persons. His wife is dedicated to the household chores, and every once in a while she helps her husband work on the farm.

Arturo is a farmer. From the time he was little his father taught him how to perform the farming jobs such as planting corn, beans and jicama. He currently works on two hectares of jicama and also one hectare of beans.

The money from this loan will be invested to pay the rent for the ground that he cultivates and to buy supplies. His purpose is to be able to work and be successful in his farming, and he knows that with his effort and the help of the loan that he can achieve it.

loans.use: to pay the rent for the ground that he cultivates and to buy supplies.

loans.name: Oishamo

texts.en: Oishamo is 33 years old. She lives with her family in the district of Muminobod. Her husband is a general laborer, and her children are minors. Oishamo has engaged in agriculture for six years. She has her own land.  Oishamo works hard every day. Her husband also helps her in the work. She would like to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds, and plant crops. She wants to expand her business and support her family in good living conditions. Unfortunately, Oishamo does not have enough money. For this reason she applied for a loan, with the hope that Kiva lenders will support her. In future Oishamo wants to continue the partnership.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer and seeds, and plant crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old, married, and has two children. To earn a living, she owns and manages a sari-sari store business. She earns a monthly income of  PHP 2,500 to help with her children's daily needs. Recently, she needed financial assistance to buy additional grocery items to sell in the store. That's why she requested a loan again. The purpose is also to increase her store inventory and generate more income.

Grace's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of her children's education.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items to sell in the store.

loans.name: Gulzira

texts.en:
Gulzira is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1988. She is living in a beautiful small town where the residents are hospitable to one another. She is single and lives with her parents. She worked at a hospital for children. 

After participating in training provided by IMON to startup clients she decided to open a new business. She wants to start a business in agriculture, drying and processing apricots. She is well known among neighbors and friends as an honest, responsible and goal-oriented person. She hopes to do business well and earn money to live better.

loans.use: to buy apricots for drying.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a 59-year-old married woman with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Diosdada has a fishing business in the Philippines. Diosdada requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Diosdada has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Diosdada would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is a married woman with 11 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dionesia is 47 years old and has three children who are in school.

Dionesia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Dionesia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Dionesia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Dionesia would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Myrna successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Myrna's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is 62 years old, married and has four children. 

Rogelia is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Rogelia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Rogelia has been farming banana for five years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rogelia would like to save enough money to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Virginia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Virginia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 54 years old, married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Gloria has a fishing business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and repair her fishing boat.

Gloria has been in this business for four years. In the future, Gloria would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Floradelia

texts.en:
Floradelia is 31 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Floradelia has a general store business in the Philippines. Floradelia requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Floradelia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Floradelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Marianna

texts.en:
Marianna is from Tegh village of Syunik region, where she lives with her husband and two little kids. Marianna's husband is an army officer, so she has to take care of the farm and her kids alone.
 
She currently keeps four cows, three calves and hens, and also cultivates wheat and some grass
. 
Marianna perfectly manages to sustain the farm and gather income from it. She has now applied for this loan to purchase three cows and expand her livestock.
 
As this is Marianna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Marianna get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses.

loans.use: to pay for three cows

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 48 years old. She lives in the small village of Vani district with her father. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize, nut trees and have small vineyard. They produce wine and sell it with the harvested products. 

Lela decided to start a husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2800 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a cow and a calf and will start producing dairy products to sell as well as for family use. The new business will increase the family income and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a calf

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 46 years old and he lives in Ugac Sur with his family. He has a child. To gain income, he provides transport services to the people in his village. He hopes to increase his income so he is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to maintain his motorcycle. He will also buy gasoline for the motorcycle.

In the future, Robert hopes to continue extending safe travel to his passengers and gain good income.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a native from Mcarthur, Leyte. A father of six dependents, his oldest child is 19 and youngest is one year old respectively. He raises and sells hogs as his main source of income. It has been five years now that he has been raising hogs. He is now facing financial problems in how he could continue his hog raising business. 

He is asking for a loan to buy piglets and purchase materials for renovating the pig pen. These materials are very useful in making his pig pen a suitable place for the hogs to stay. He could raise quality hogs and it would create a high impact on his earnings. Thus, he could now afford to buy nutritious meals for the whole family, and also continue to send his children to school.

Roberto would like to expand his hog raising business for the welfare of his children and to provide them with better living condition as well.

loans.use: to buy piglets and purchase materials for renovating the pig pen.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like noodles, sugar, soft drinks and other groceries.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a food vending business. 

Marissa dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like noodles, sugar, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Maria Feliz

texts.es: Maria tiene 44 años de edad, esta divorciada, Maria tiene 5 hijos, de 22,18,17 10 y 9 años de  edad, los 3 hijos menores se encuentran estudiando, Maria desde muy joven se dedica  a la crianza de animales , a la agricultura y al jornal de trabajos del agricultura, Maria solicita el dinero del credito para comprar abono, fungicidas, y pagar de mano de obra a quienes le ayudan a mantener sus cultivos sanos, Maria siembra papas, quinua, mellocos y otros productos que se dan este lugar. Maria comenta que sola ha sacado adelante a sus hijos y que los 2  mayores ya trabajan y que aunque no pudo darles el estudio les enseña la actividad de la agricultura. Maria tiene la aspiracion de trabajar en sus cultivos y al final tener una excelente cosecha y tener una buena ganancia para de ahí pagar la mantencion de sus hijos y sobre todo el estudio de los que asisten a algun centro educativo.
texts.en:
Maria, 44, is divorced and has five children, 22, 18, 17, 10, and nine years old.  The three youngest children are studying.  Since she was very young, Maria has made a living raising animals, in agriculture, and in agricultural day labor.  
She is requesting a loan to buy manure and fungicides and to pay for the labor of those who help her keep her crops healthy.  Maria plants potatoes, quinoa, mellocos (a tuber)  and other products which grow in this place.  
Maria says she has brought up her children by herself and, though she was not able to give them all schooling, she taught them the work of agriculture.  She aspires to work with her plants and finally to have a good crop and have good earnings from which to pay for the maintenance of her children and above all for the studies of those who go to the education center.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicides.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 55 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Julieta has a general store business in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Julieta has been in this business for four years. In the future, Julieta would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 52 years old, married and has four children.  

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gemma is 50 years old and has three children who are in school.

Gemma has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Elca

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Elca works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing-sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Elca is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items like curtains, towels, pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Elca has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like curtains, towels, pants, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Los Jovenes Activos De Chaquijya Group

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven de 24 años, es soltero vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Miguel (es el primero del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de playera verde rayado) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa, trabaja para una institución privada,  desde hace dos años.
Miguel por motivo de su trabajo ve la necesidad de adquirir una videograbadora profesional, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no  cuenta con el dinero suficiente  para poder comprarlo, pero él es un joven muy optimista que para poder adquirir su material de trabajo, ha organizado a un grupo de jóvenes con necesidades, para juntos solicitar su préstamo para realizar su objetivo.
Miguel sueña con poder construir su casa para cuando decida formar su familia tenga donde vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Miguel, 24, is single and lives with his parents in the town of Sololá. Miguel (the first on the left in the green striped shirt) has worked in a private business for two years, with the goal of earning money to help his parents with the household expenses.

For his work, Miguel needs to buy a professional video camera, but he doesn't have enough money to do so. This young man is very optimistic that he will be able to obtain this equipment for his work. He has organized a group of young people with various needs so that together they can ask for a loan to meet their goals.

Miguel dreams of building a house where he will live when he decides to form a family.

loans.use: to buy a video camera.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1978. She is living in a remote district. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a master of renovating houses.  She was interested in opening a new business. She likes kids and wants to trade kids' clothing. 

She participated at the Startup training provided by IMON to their clients. She was satisfied with the knowledge that she gained. Now she is asking for a loan to buy a startup collection of kids' clothing and rent a place in the domestic market to do business. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy a startup collection of kids' clothing and rent a place in the domestic market to do business

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
Maria tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con 2 hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos, además en su negocio vende gaseosas, galletas, golosinas, entre otros productos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado cerca de su casa. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de insumos como arroz, carne, pollo, menestras, entre otros, para la elaboración de sus alimentos, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio y satifacer las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, 40, is married and has two children in her care. She lives in her own home in a rural area of the Oyotun district in Chiclayo province, Lambayaqe region on the northern coast of Peru. Her community is dedicated to agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry.

Maria makes and sells food, and also sells sodas, cookies, snacks and other products in her store located in her home. She has experience with this business and has good personal and professional references in her district.

She is asking for a loan to buy large quantities of ingredients for her meals including rice, beef, chicken, lentils and other things. Her goal is to increase her business and meet the needs and tastes of her customers. This will generate more income and allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of ingredients like rice, beef, chicken, lentils and other things for preparing food.

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like vegetables, meat, frozen foods, spices, etc. for her food-vending business.

Rocelyn has been in this business for 11 years. Rocelyn earns more income from farming sugarcane and a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Rocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like vegetables, meat, frozen foods, spices, etc

loans.name: Belly

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Belly works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Belly is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Belly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 57 years old, married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Margarita has a general store business in the Philippines. Margarita requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Margarita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonora is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Leonora has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for two years. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Emma has been in this business for 18 years. Emma earns more income from buy and sell charcoal.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita hails from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married with a 21-year-old daughter. Her husband is a farmer and barely earns a living to provide for his family. Rosita, on the other hand, is engaged in raising hogs and she also operates a sari-sari store business. However, she has been struggling to keep her store well stocked. She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, soap, canned goods, noodles, spices, shampoo and toothpaste for her store. In the future, Rosita plans to make her store bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soap, canned goods, noodles, spices, shampoo and toothpaste

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 35 years old, married to Jackline, and supports a family of four members. He has been operating a business of ready-made clothes for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,500. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he plans to use to increase his stock so as to satisfy his clients and earn more income. 

He plans to use the profit to repay the loan, as well as educate his children. His hope is to lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: To increase his stock so as to satisfy his clients and earn more income.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional raw ingredients, such as pork, fish, chicken and seasonings that are needed for her food stall business. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy pork, fish, chicken and seasonings to cook dishes to sell at her food stall. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Julieta dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies

. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans

loans.use: To buy fresh meat, vegetables, oil and other ingredients needed for her food stall.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Francisca works hard to support her family.

She has a beauty salon business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell dressed chicken.  Francisca is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to pays for laborers salary and purchase other materials for her beauty salon business.

Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pays for laborers salary and purchase other materials for her salon

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 39 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Susan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Susan would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Grupo Pacut Group

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 21años de edad, es soltera vive en una comunidad denominada Pacut junto a sus hija de tres años.
Ana (es la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de blusa verde) con el objetivo de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica desde hace cinco años a la venta de café en el lugar de su comunidad.
Para Ana no hay nada más importante que el cultivo de café pues es de donde proviene sus ingresos, es por ello que desde hace algún tiempo había cultivado unas parcelas de café, que en estos momentos ya necesitan de su mantenimiento,  a pesar de todos sus esfuerzos no ha logrado darle mantenimiento, por tal razón ella junto a un grupo de personas esta solicitando un crédito que lo utilizara para comprar sus insumos agrícolas y darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café.
Ana espera seguir sembrando más plantaciones de café para mejorar la calidad de vida de su querida familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 21, is single and lives in a community called Pacut with her three-year-old daughter. Ana (first on the left in the green blouse) started selling coffee 5 years ago with the goal of earning income and helping her family to get ahead. For Ana, nothing is more important than her coffee crop, since that is her source of income.

For some time now she has cultivated several parcels of land and they currently need maintenance which, in spite of all her efforts, she has not been able to perform. For that reason she joined a group of people asking for a loan, which she will use to buy agricultural inputs and do maintenance on her coffee crop.

Ana hopes to continue planting more coffee plantations so that she can improve her beloved family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for their coffee crop.

loans.name: Dúo Fe En Cristo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Fe En Cristo, doña María Ana empezó su negocio con la cantidad de 25 libras de
Maíz y elaborando tortillas para vender en los tres tiempos de comida, Ahora bien solicita un crédito para comprar más mercadería para poder tener(maiz para elaboracion de tortillas)
Un mejor negocio y tener mejores ganancias. Agradece a Dios y sus padres por haberle
Enseñado a negociar para sacar adelante a sus hijos, su mayor anhelo es poder tener
Más grande la tortillería esperando el apoyo que necesita de fape gracias.
texts.en:
Maria Ana began her business with 25 pounds of corn. She makes tortillas to sell at meal times. She is asking for a loan to buy more corn to make her tortillas. This will make her business better and she will have more profits.

She is thankful to God and her parents for having taught her to do business to take care of her children. Her biggest wish is to be able to have a larger tortilla business. She is thankful for the support that she hopes to receive from FAPE.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store business.

Rowena dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ernestina Iluces

texts.es: Ernestina es madre soltera, tiene 55 años de edad, tiene  5 hijos, de ellos 4 ya son independientes y trabajan al jornal, el menor de ellos tiene 17 años y asiste al colegio, Ernestina comenta que su hijo tambien trabaja a medio tiempo para ayudarse en las gastos de sus estudios, Ernestina se dedica a trabajar al jornal y tambien sienbra pequeñas huertas de productos que se dan en su provincia, Ernestina nececita el dinero del credito para comprar fungicidas y abono para que sus cultivos  esten sanos y den abundante produccion. Ernestina tiene la aspiracion de seguir trabajando y en medio de su pobreza tener los ingresos para que su hijo termine por lo menos la secundaria.
texts.en:
Ernestina, 55, is a single mother with 5 children, four of whom are independent and working. The youngest, age 17, is in high school. Ernestina says that her youngest son also works part-time to help out with the cost of his schooling.

Ernestina is a day laborer and also plants small gardens of local produce. Ernestina needs money to buy fungicides and compost so that her crops are healthy and productive.

Ernestina's aspiration is to keep working and, even though she is poor, to have income so that her son can at least finish high school.

loans.use: to buy compost and fungicides.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Carmelina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Carmelina requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Carmelina has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. May

texts.en:
Ma. May is 47 years old and married with three children. With two children are still in school, Ma. May works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. May runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, soft-drinks, etc.

Ma. May has been in this business for 4 years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, soft-drinks, etc

loans.name: Oscar Fabricio

texts.es: Oscar es un joven que vive con su madre y sus 4 hermanos, Oscar tiene 22 años de edad, Oscar crecio con su madre y siempre con limitaciones ya que su padre nunca les ayudo en ningun gasto de su hogar, Oscar apenas pudo terminar la secundaria y de alli tubo que salir a trabajar al jornal para ayudar a su madre en los gastos darios  y a sus hermanos que estan estudiando, Oscar tambien se dedica  a la crianaza de ganado y por este motivo solicita el credito para comprar  terneros, Oscar tiene la aspiracion de seguir trabajando, apoyar  en los gastos de su hogar, en los estudios de sus hermanos y a su madre que mucho le necesita.
texts.en:
Oscar, 22, lives with his mother and four siblings. He grew up with a single mother, and his father never helped out with expenses, so they always had limitations. Oscar was barely able to finish high school, and after that he had to become a day laborer to help his mother with their daily costs for his siblings who are still in school.

Oscar also raises cattle and he is asking for a loan to buy calves. Oscar hopes to continue working and supporting his mother who needs his help and his siblings so they can continue studying.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Avdina

texts.en:
Avdina is a 56-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in a small village in Chiatura district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two cows and produce cheese to sell. In addition, they own a small piece of agricultural land where they grow maize and haricot, which is only for family use. 

Avdina has a great desire to expand her husbandry business and plans to purchase a pig. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase a pig and will resell piglets in the future in order to increase her income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a pig and expand her husbandry business

loans.name: Chuajuyub Group

texts.es:
Diego (es el primero del lado izquierdo)es un hombre de 59 años, vive junto a su familia en una comunidad de denominada Chuajuyub, él se encuentra muy agradecido por el crédito al que tuvo acceso porque gracias a ello logro comprar sus insumos para el mantenimiento de Maxan, con la que al obtener la cosecha obtuvo muy buenas ganancias y pudo comprar media cuerda de terreno, pero el ahora nuevamente se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un crédito y junto a su grupo tramitan un nuevo crédito  para poder darle mantenimiento a sus tres cuerdas de Maxan.
Diego tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder tener una buena cosecha de Maxan esta temporada, y seguir sembrando más plantaciones de Maxan.
texts.en:
Diego (first from left), 59, lives with his family in a community called Chuajuyub. He is very grateful for the previous loan because thanks to that he was able to buy inputs to maintain his crop of maxan [a leaf used to wrap tamales]. He got very good profits from his harvest and was able to buy a half-cuerda of land [a cuerda is a unit of area that varies from 280 to 1745 square meters].

Now he once again needs to ask for a loan, along with his group, so that he can do maintenance on three cuerdas of maxan crops. Diego hopes that with this loan he will get a good maxan harvest this season and be able to continue planting more land with maxan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for maintaining a maxan (Calathea lutea) crop.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna and her husband work at a local village school. They have two sons. The elder is a cook working at a local restaurant. After her work, Susanna is also involved in farming. She keeps 15 hens and cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes. Her husband helps Susanna sell the harvest in the market. 

Both Susanna and her husband have always known that they wanted a big and sustainable farm, so they have worked hard to achieve that goal. By applying for this loan, Susanna asks lenders to support her to purchase a cow and to pay for cultivation work to develop the farming business and gather more income for the family. 

This is Susanna's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions, was very difficult to pay back, and Susanna faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her recent hard work, she and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. So Susanna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and cultivation

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is a 34-year-old mother with two children who are 11 and 8 years old. She is married and her husband is a driver. Araceli has two small businesses: raising hogs and selling Tupperware and Avon products. She started her business seven years ago. They usually allow her to earn 3,000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and feed. She is optimistic that this will help to bring in more income in the future. 

Her profit will be for school fees, food for the family and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is thankful that she was granted a PHP 10,000 loan, which she used to purchase beauty, skin products and cleaning agents as well. Aside from being a dealer of personal goods, she also has a tricycle that her husband drives for a transport service. Her earnings were a big help with the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to pay for tire replacement, fuel and maintenance of her tricycle. Her income from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marisol plans to buy another tricycle to serve the growing population in their area. She wants all her children to have a college education and see them become professionals one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for tire replacement, fuel and maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Grupo Chuisanto Tomas Group

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 23 años de edad es soltera, vive en una comunidad de aldea Chuisanto Tomas junto a sus dos hijos de las edades entre 1 y 2 años.
Catarina (es la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa morada) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica  a la venta de café desde hace cinco años, en el lugar de su comunidad.
Ella desde hace algún tiempo había sembrado una parcelas de café que ahora ya necesita de su mantenimiento, pero una de las dificultades que Catarina tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar sus insumos agrícolas; aunque ella es una mujer con liderazgo por tal razón organizo a un grupo de señoras con las mismas necesidades  para juntas solicitar un crédito para comprar sus fertilizantes,  insecticidas y fungicidas.
Catarina sueña con poder seguir sembrando más plantaciones de café y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Catarina is a 23 year-old woman. She is single and lives in the community of the small village of Chuisanto Tomas with her two children who are 1 and 2 years old. In the picture, Catarina is the first person on the right, in the purple blouse. With the goal of earning an income and supporting her family, Catarina sells coffee in a place in the community. She has been doing this work for five years. For a little while now she has also raised coffee crops on small parcels of land, and now she needs to take care of those crops. One of her greatest difficulties is that she does not have enough money to purchase agricultural supplies. However, she is a leader, so she organized a group of women with the same needs so that together they can request a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and fungicides. Catarina dreams of being able to continue planting more parcels of land and of improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and fungicides to maintain their coffee crop.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en: Nodira is a talented woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a master at renovation of houses. She has an activity of sewing traditional women dresses at home. Separately, she studies at a medical university. It is her six-year-education of medicine. Partly, she is a nurse at hospital. She wants to be educated and be a family doctor. She likes to sew and study. She does not have money to pay her tuition fee for her studies. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to pay her higher education costs. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay her higher education costs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Rebecca is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old, married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like rice, sardines, sugar, etc. to sell.

Gemma has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like rice, sardines, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Utulivu A Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ngusu est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Utulivu A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un meunier, âgée de 44 ans, mère 5 enfants dont 4 étudient et 1 a deja fini ses études. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de sa maman. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un dépôt de la ville depuis son jeune âge. Elle va s’approvisionner en sacs de maïs, sacs de soja, farine de format, etc. Elle compte construire sa maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Client Ngusu is a merchant, and member of the "Utulivu A" banc villageois (loan association). She is client of the Hekima MFI, married to a miller, and at 44 years of age the mother of five children, four of whom attend school and the fifth has finished studying.

She started her business with funds received from her mother. Since she was young she has sold food in one of the city's depots. She will stock up on bags of maize, soybeans, wheat flour, etc.

She intends to build her house, educate and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Stock up on bags of maize, soybean, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es: Maria  es madre soltera que tiene 26 años de edad, Maria tiene una hija de 9 años y 2 hijos de 4 años y 5 años de edad. Maria vive en el campo donde hay espacio para criar animales, Maria se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y tambien es empleada de obrera en una fabrica que elabora quesos, Maria necesita el dinero del credito para hacer la compra de chanchos, La mayor aspiarcion de Maria es la de seguir adelante en su trabajo y comprar mas chanchos para que su negocio sea mas productivo y asi que sus ingresos le permitan dar la educacion, alimentacion y demas necesidades a sus 3 hijos.
texts.en: Maria is a single mother. She is 26 years old and has a 9 year old daughter and two sons who are 4 and 5 years old. She lives in the countryside where she has room to raise animals. Maria works raising small animals, and she also works in a cheese making factory. Maria needs the money from this loan in order to purchase hogs. Her greatest dream is to get ahead in her work and to purchase more pigs so that her business can be more productive. This will enable her to provide her children with nutrition, education and everything else they need.

loans.use: to purchase hogs.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 58 years old.  He is married and he supports 8 family members. 

He has been a dairy farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 9,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to use to buy a dairy cow to increase the amount of milk supplied to his clients daily.  

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase the milk supplied to his clients daily.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 24 years old, married and has one child in school.  

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.  She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 43 years old and married with four children, all of whom are still in school. Margie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, noodles, spices, canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee and other personal care products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Margie has been in this business for 9 years.

She would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 47 years old and married with one child who is in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like noodles, sardines, coffee, etc. to sell.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.  

In the future Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like noodles, sardines, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon is 28 years old young man, from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He lives with pensioner parents and brother, who is an accountant at the building company. Levon is temporarily unemployed and is unable to start any stable job. He is eager to have his own income and requested a loan among local credit providers. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Levon applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting people to start or re-start businesses. Levon has a wife in abroad, who will send Levon the various kitchen installation, that have high prices in our country and Levon will sell it in a cheaply prices. He will get private orders, as the demand is high and will get significant profit. 
The new business initiative will give him a chance to get his own income and become financially independent. Levon will make his bit to the family's welfare and will be thankful for the financial support.

loans.use: To trade in kitchen installations and become financially independent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy different kinds of fabrics, sewing thread, fasteners, matching lace.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 33 years old and married with three children who are in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like can goods, egg, milk, soap, etc.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like can goods, egg, milk, soap, etc

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es una mujer de 49 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 15 y 25 años, está humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Dominga con el afán de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica desde hace cuatro años, gracias a esta labor ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Dominga ahora ha decidido mejorar su negocio, pero para poder hacerlo ella necesita de un capital para comprar más ropas típicas  como güipiles, cortes, fajas y delantales, por tal razón solicita un crédito para realizar la inversión es un negocio.
Dominga confía en conseguir este crédito para poder mejorar sus ingresos para luego comprar un terreno para que sus hijos tengan donde vivir en un futuro.
texts.en: Dominga is a 49 year-old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family of three children who are between 15 and 25 years old. Their small family lives in a community of Suchitepéquez. In an effort to generate income and support her family, Dominga purchases and sells traditional clothing. She has done this for the past four years, and thanks to this work she has managed to get her family ahead. She has decided that it's time to improve her business, but in order to do so she needs capital to purchase more traditional clothing items such as dresses, skirts, belts and smocks. In order to do this she needs a loan to make this investment in her business. Dominga says that if she is able to obtain this loan and improve her earnings, she will then purchase a piece of land so that her children have a place to live in the future.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing such as dresses, skirts, belts and smocks.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her buy and sell rice. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Judith dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
Mavzuna is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1980. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is divorced and has one child. It became hard to her raise her child and feed her family. She decided to do business in order to have income to ensure family needs were met. 

She has livestock; it is an additional source of earning money. But recently, she is planning to do business with buying and selling grocery products. She participated at a training called “Women Entrepreneur – Achieve Success” provided by IMON to startup clients. She wants to sell in a small store nearby a secondary school in her area. 

Mavzuna requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy startup grocery products and do business. She hopes to be supported.
