Tsiala is a 62-year-old married woman. She lives in the Rustavi district with her two grandchildren, who go to school. 

Tsiala works at local beauty salon, where she is a nails specialist. She wants to start an additional business activity and needs 600 GEL to purchase hens. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan for starting her business. With the received credit, she will purchase hens and sell eggs. This will bring her an additional income, which will be great support for Tsiala.

loans.use: to purchase hens and sell eggs in order to increase family income.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Ruth. She is a single mother aged thirty four years old and blessed with two children. 

Ruth does banana farming to earn a living. This helps her to support her family needs. She wants to expand her business but she has financial constraints, making it necessary for her to take out a Kiva loan. The loan will help to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer that will help boost production. She is looking forward to more income from improved sales, which will help her to pay school fees for her children.

Ruth is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer that will improve farm output.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her mama lishe (local eatery)

loans.name: Ingris Rosibel

texts.es:
Ingris es una joven de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° grado en la escuela de la comunidad, se casó a los 17 años, su esposo trabaja de corralero cuidando vacas ajenas, las cuales tiene que estar pendientes del ordeño y su mantenimiento, tiene dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando.

Ingris trabaja en la elaboración de hamacas, también hace carteras y bolsos desde que tenía 8 años de edad, oficio que aprendió de sus padres, también trabaja en la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral y actualmente está en un proyecto de barrer las calles.

Ella está solicitando este crédito para comprar materiales para la elaboración de hamacas como lo es el hilo de seda y de poliseda, así podrá seguir con su negocio generando ganancias junto a su esposo.

Su sueño es poder construir su casa para vivir de una mejor manera y en el algo propio junto a su familia, también desea poder ayudar a sus hijos a terminar sus estudios y que sigan adelante para ser personas de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Ingris is a young woman. She is 24 years old and studied up to the third grade at the community school. She got married when she was 17. Her husband works taking care of someone else’s cows; he has to milk them and make sure they are in good shape. They have two children who go to school.

Ingris makes hammocks. She also makes purses and bags. She has been doing this since she was eight years old, taught by her parents. She also raises pigs and domesticated birds, and is now involved in a project to sweep the streets.

Ingris is requesting this loan to buy materials to make hammocks, such as silk threads and fabrics, in order to continue with her business and make money together with her husband. Her dream is to be able to build a house in order to live more comfortably and have something that belongs to the family. She wants to help her children to finish their studies, get ahead, and become good, useful people for society.

loans.use: to buy materials to make hammocks, such as silk threads and fabrics.

loans.name: Ruteerwa Abeteraine Group

texts.en:
George, age 38 years, is a married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda, and a member of a village bank. 

He trades in cattle, fattening them until they are ready for market, supplemented by milk sales for extra income. This is a business he started so as to meet his family's needs. 

George intends to use the loan to buy cattle to fatten and sell. He is a determined man who desires to build a permanent house for his family even though he is challenged by inadequate capital and needing to travel long distances to sell in various markets.

loans.use: To buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Vitari

texts.en:
Vitari, a 35-year-old hardworking man, runs a motor vehicle spare parts shop in Kamwenge, Uganda, as his main source of income. He also owns rentals and carries out banana growing and selling to earn extra income. 

He was inspired by the need to improve on his standard of living. He so much wishes to expand his business and have a big garage in his area; however, he is challenged by the high rate of inflation and competition.

He intends to use a loan to buy more motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 53 years old, married and a father of six children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the enterprise development and financial management training.

He is a vegetable farmer and is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizers and quality seeds, thus increasing vegetable production. This will increase his income and enable him meet his family's expenses at ease.

John is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and quality seeds, thus increasing vegetable production for more income to meet his family's expenses.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 38, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Arlene has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Arlene requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Arlene would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a group leader, age 40. She is married and has four children between 9 and 18 years old. All of them go to school. 

The group is called Dufatanye, which means “Altogether” in English. They sell various products and they wish to expand their businesses to improve their  future. 

Beatrice sells food and has been doing this business for the past seven years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more maize, rice and coffee to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more maize, rice and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose is 40 years old and married with 3 children, and he lives in Kasese, Uganda.  

Ambrose is a butcher and also a crop farmer, growing mainly maize, rice and tomatoes to earn a living. However, he is faced with the challenges of market competition and floods that affect his crops. He is requesting a loan to buy goats and cows for slaughtering.

He dreams of educating his children and expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows for slaughtering.

loans.name: Shirley Paola

texts.es: Shirley de 36 años de edad, identificó en el sector donde vive en el suroccidente de Barranquilla una oportunidad de negocio; ella fue inspirada por su cónyuge, quien se dedica a una actividad similar, él comercializa teléfonos celulares y accesorios en el centro de la ciudad.  Shirley consideró que éste negocio podría adaptarse en el barrio donde residen, entonces tomó la iniciativa de empezar a vender desde la comodidad de su casa, donde adapto un espacio y lo adecuo como local comercial.  Tan pronto como inauguró su venta de accesorios para celulares, fue adquiriendo nuevos servicios, entre ellos una fotocopiadora.  Shirley es madre de dos niñas de 17 y 1 año de edad y de un niño de 10 años,  quienes cuentan con una madre trabajadora, pero que a la vez esta al tanto de las labores en el hogar y la responsabilidad del cuidado de sus hijos, quienes demandan cuidado y amor.  Gracias a esta oportunidad laborar los ingresos familiares han podido incrementarse,  mejorando las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de sus hijos,  en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para mejorar el surtido de su negocio, comprará accesorios para celulares como protectores, cargadores, baterías y audífonos.   Shirley labora todos los días, ella es muy responsable y comprometida con su negocio, su meta familiar es continuar ofreciéndole a sus hijos una educación de calidad y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Shirley is 36 years old. She spotted a business opportunity in the area where she lives in the south-west of Barranquilla; she got the idea from her husband who has a similar business. He sells cell phones and accessories in the city centre. 

Shirley felt that this business would work well in the neighbourhood where they live, so she decided to begin selling from the comfort of her home. She converted a suitable space in her home into commercial premises. As soon as she had started the business selling accessories for cell phones, she added other services such as a photocopier. 

Shirley is mother to two daughters aged 17 and 1 and a son aged 10 who now have a working mother. She also needs to stay on top of the housework and the responsibility for looking after her children, who need love and care. 

Thanks to this business opportunity, the family income has risen, improving their quality of life and the well-being of the children.

She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first one with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to stock up her business. She will buy accessories for cell phones like covers, chargers, batteries and earphones. 

Shirley works every day, she is very responsible and implicated in her business. Her objectives for her family are to be able to continue giving her children a good education and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy accessories for cell phones like covers, chargers, batteries and earphones

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is from Nyamira. She has had to overcome many adversities in her life. Nevertheless, she has always had the strength to come out ahead and continue progressing with her family. She has spent the past 13 years farming. She sells eggs, tea, and vegetables produced on her farm. She earns additional income from a personal business. 

Gladys is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. Gladys wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan for 10,000 KES, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With this loan, Gladys will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm, which will generate enough income to repay the loan and allow her to save extra money. Gladys is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. She hopes for a secure future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 35 years old and lives in Lessos village in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is a farmer, raising dairy cows and poultry. She also has a borehole where she fetches water for both domestic and agricultural use. 

Irene is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase cereals to sell to her neighbors and to the local market. Her dream is to increase her cereal vending business and have it as one of her main sources of income. In order to achieve this, she has partnered with other local farmers to form a group so that they can access co-guaranteed loans. Income generated from the cereal vending business will enable her to repay the loan on time and she will use the additional amount to meet her family's basic needs and education costs.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! The above picture presents Ruth, a hardworking woman who has never stopped dreaming. She has always had faith that one day life would turn in her favor. She is based in Ekerenyo village, where she has a 0.5-acre farm and a small house made out of earth, with two habitable rooms. 

On the farm, she keeps dairy cows, chickens and grows vegetables which she uses for both consumption and sale. These activities have enabled her to raise four children. Ruth's own upbringing was so difficult that she never had the privilege of attending school. 

Ruth is seeking a loan to venture into commercial poultry farming. With the loan, she will acquire a brood of hens that will lay eggs for food, sale and hatching. This business is projected to significantly increase her income. The birds will also bring life into her home, as they will be free-range and scratch the earth for bugs. 

The money from the investment will enable Ruth to afford basic needs and save up for the future. This loan will go a long way in empowering her to become a better entrepreneur and improve her family's living standards.

Your loan is very important in Ruth’s life, kindly lend to her.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis lives in Gyumri with his wife, son and daughter. 

He is a farmer. Some years ago, on his farm near his house, Sargis was keeping cows and calves. Unfortunately, they all died from disease and Sargis had to start his agribusiness again. He chose beekeeping because it is profitable. People use honey everyday and consider it healthy. The high quality honey that Sargis produces is in high demand.
 
Sargis now needs some financial support from lenders to purchase 26 colonies of bees to expand his beekeeping business.
 
Sargis is from the town of Gyumri where a catastrophic earthquake in 1988 still has a great impact on human physical and mental health. People from this town still face poor living conditions, high unemployment rates and many other difficulties in developing their businesses. 

Sargis' loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva.  This initiative provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, helping them to access the market and earn a living.

Sragis hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase 26 colonies of bees and expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bunches of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 47 years old with three grown children. She is from Ormoc City, Leyte. 

For 27 years, she has been farming rice and raising hogs for a living. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for the labor costs of the hired help. 

Angelina hopes to expand her business and live in the abundance of her crops and income. She also dreams of living in comfort in her old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for the labor costs of the hired help.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 37 years old and has three children, one of whom is in school.  Marites is married.

Marites is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Marites has been raising pigs for eleven years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marites would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a hardworking farmer from Kamwenge, Uganda. He also supplies coffee to farmers as a side income business. 

He wishes to expand his business and have a big store in his area, however he is challenged by the high inflation rate and competition. He was inspired to expand by the need to educate his children. 

Benon is requesting a loan to purchase manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to purchase manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a resident of Ormoc, Leyte. She is 24 years old and married with three children, ages one, four and six. Daisy's husband is a driver and barely earns enough to provide their food. 

Daisy helps by raising hogs to augment the family's income. She also sells soft drinks. Daisy is asking for a loan to buy feed, piglets and soft drinks. 

She is hoping to increase her business profits so that all her children can go to school. Her income will also help secure a healthy meal for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost his farming through application of modern farming technology to increase production for more income.

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
Carlos, de 30 años de edad, es soldado, estudio hasta sexto grado, no continuo sus estudios debido a la falta de recusros economicos en que vivian sus padres; está casado y junto a su esposa tienen 2 hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad, los 2 están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad y su esposa se dedica al cuido de sus hijos y a los quehaceres del hogar.

Carlos, trabaja de ayudante de albañil desde hace 1 año, antes de este trabajo se dedicaba a trabajar como vigilante.- Para trasladarse hacia su trabajo recorre 3 kilometros en su motocicleta y su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. todos los dias.

Carlos, solicita el préstamo para comprar láminas y tubos para poder ampliar su vivienda y asi darle a su familia mejores comodidades.

El sueño de Carlos, es poder comprar una vivienda grande, ya que en la que viven es un poco pequeña.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 30-year-old soldier.  He studied until the 6th grade, but he didn't continue after that because his parents lacked the necessary economic resources.  He is married and has 2 children with his wife who are 8 and 4 years old.  They study at a school in the community and his wife is dedicated to taking care of their children and household chores. 

Carlos has been working as an assistant builder for a year.  Before that, he worked as a security guard.  He rides a motorcycle 3 kilometers to get to work and he works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

Carlos is requesting a loan to buy metal sheeting and pipes to be able to expand his home so that his family can live more comfortably.

Carlos' dream is to be able to buy a big house, since the one that they live in is a little small.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and pipes to expand his home

loans.name: Neri Elmer Iván

texts.es:
Neri de 63 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tiene tres hijos que ya están casados y son independientes.


Desde hace muchos años Neri se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa y zapatos, el negocio lo aprendió debido a que hay poco trabajo como albañil así que decidió comercializar ropa.


Él solicita este préstamo para comprar zapatos para damas y caballeros y ropa para niños, de esta forma podrá surtir su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.

El sueño de Neri es tener siempre el negocio para que no le falten los ingresos económicos y poder pagas el crédito.
texts.en:
Neri is 63 years old and studied until high school. He is married and his wife makes a living in household chores. They have three children who are already married and independent.

For many years Neri has made a living in the sale of clothing and shoes, a business he learned because there was very little work as a bricklayer so he decided to sell clothes.

He is requesting this loan to buy shoes for ladies and gentlemen and clothing for children, and in this way he will be able to support his business and improve his earnings.

His dream is to always have the business so that he will not miss income and be able to pay for the loan.

loans.use: to buy shoes for ladies and gentlemen and clothes for children.

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is 47 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school.  Emilda works very hard to provide for them.

Emilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Emilda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Maranatha Group

texts.es: Dúo Maranatha Doña Romelia de 50 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes. Romelia  es  comerciante de ropa americana y productos varios como, cosméticos etc., en esta oportunidad ella solicita un nuevo crédito  para surtir más su negocio y así tener mas que ofrecer a sus clientes. el sueño de Romelia es agrandar su negocio y expandirlo  a varios lugares y obtener más ganancias y así lograr sus sueños y sus metas.
texts.en:
Dúo Maranatha

Romelia, age 50, has three children who are now independent.  Romelia sells American clothes and various products like cosmetics, etc.

At this time she is requesting a new loan to stock her business more.  This way she will have more to offer her customers.

Romelia’s dream is to expand her business to various locations and to get more earnings.  This way she will achieve her dreams and her goals.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 33 years old and comes from Ormoc City in Leyte. She is married with two children ages two and nine. May has been in the business of making hollow blocks for the last three years. This business gives her family a good income. 

May would like to expand her business but she needs additional capital. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy cement, screen sand and coco lumber. May is determined to make her business successful so she can support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cement, screen sand and coco lumber

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 51 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Virgilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like mineral water, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Virgilia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Virgilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like mineral water, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 51 years old and has five children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rowena has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina, 37, is a married with five children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina has had a general store business in the Philippines for 15 years. Gina requested a 25,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, in order to buy items to sell in her store such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Meriam is 25 years old and has one child in school.

Meriam has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Meriam has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Urukundo Cb Group

texts.en:
Eugenie is the group leader.  She is 39 years old and married with 4 children between the ages of 10 and 17. 

The group's name, Urukundo Cb, means “the Love” in English. The members sell different products and wish to expand their business to change their future for the better. 

Eugenie sells foodstuffs and has been running her business for 6 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more bananas, cassava and posho to sell. The profits from the loan will be used to expand in her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, cassava and posho to sell.

loans.name: Reah

texts.en:
Reah is 32 years old and a widow with five children, who are all attending school. Reah works very hard to provide for them.

Reah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Reah has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Reah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es:
Jesus, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos, pero solo uno vive con él, el otro está acompañado y tiene su propio hogar.

Jesus, trabaja con ganado de repasto bovino, lo ha hecho por más de 7 años y lo aprendio de su padre, decidio hacerlo para mantener a su familia y a la vez para inculcarles el trabajo a sus hijos, tambien trabaja en la albañileria, antes solo era agricultor.

Jesus, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, con esto mejorara sus ingresos, porque podra tener más ganado.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para poder darle un mejor futuro a su familia y el préstamo le ayudara a lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Jesus studied until the third grade and is married. His wife is engaged in household chores. They have two children, but only one lives with them, and the other is married and has his own home.

Jesus works with cattle in the cattle pasture, which he has been doing for more than 7 years and learned from his father. He decided to do it to take care of his family and also to instill the work in his children. He also works in masonry, previously he was only a farmer.

Jesus needs a loan to buy cattle pasture land, and with this he will improve his income, because he will be able to have more cattle.

His dreams are to continue working in order to give a better future to his family and that the loan will help him achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy cattle pasture land.

loans.name: Mistubishi Group

texts.en:
Charles, who is in his late 20s, is single with one small kid. He has been running two projects, selling bricks and operating a food shop, for three years now. He works from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Charles's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the shop inventory and to make more bricks, which he sold to many customers. He is doing great! He used the profit to take care of his kid and the kid's mother, make loan repayments and cover household expenses.

Charles will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in his shop inventory and to buy more supplies - a lorry of sand, bags of cement and enough water - for making bricks to meet his customers' demand. He dreams of building his own house.

Charles will share this loan with his loan group Mistubishi, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in his shop inventory and to buy more supplies - a lorry of sand, bags of cement and enough water - for making bricks to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Rocio Andrea

texts.es:
Rocio es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de Nutrición. 
Ella es inteligente, responsable, constante, dulce, cariñosa, sensible y muy estudiosa. Sus estudios lo realiza en la universidad pública ubicada en la zona central; área caracterizada por encontrarse rodeada de edificios que albergan a oficinas comerciales, públicas, restaurantes, plazas y todo tipo de comercios, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 3-14 grados centígrados. 
Rocio es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya casi no habla porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres junto a sus 2 hermanas menores que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella cursa la carrera de Nutrición y se encuentra en 2 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; se siente motivada por su sensibilidad social, es de buena disposición en la atención a las personas, le gusta responder a los problemas de salud nutricional y cuenta con una firme vocación por el estudio de las ciencias de la nutrición y la alimentación, al servicio de la sociedad, “Pienso realizar consultorías, investigaciones e integrar equipos multidisciplinarios para modificar de buena manera la situación alimentaria y nutricional de las personas…” comenta. La ventaja de su carrera es que la demanda de profesionales en esta área es alta, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de material de estudio. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y especializarse en suplementos nutricionales para deportistas, ella desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios y terminar su carrera. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Rocio solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora personal para continuar con sus estudios profesionales y especializarse en nutrición deportiva.
texts.en:
Rocio is a young, 20-year-old woman, who is a single and doesn't have children.  She is getting a degree in nutrition.  She is intelligent, responsible, persistent, sweet, caring, sensible, and very studious.  She studies at the public university in the center of the city, an area surrounded by buildings that hold commercial and public administration offices, restaurants, plazas, and all kinds of businesses.  The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day between 3-14 degrees celsius.  

Rocio has a short stature and thin build with a dark complexion, brownish-grey eyes, and long black hair that she wears down.  Her maternal language is Aymará, but she almost never speaks it because she is studying and living in the city.  She lives in her parents' home with her 2 younger sisters who are in school.  They have their own home equipped with potable water, electricity, and plumbing.  
 
She is in the process of getting a degree in nutrition, and she is in the 2nd year of the 5-year degree.  She is motivated by her social sensibility, as she is well suited to taking care of people.  By studying diet and nutrition science, she would like to solve nutritional health problems and to be able to rely on a steady profession through her studies while serving society.  She notes that she is thinking of doing consultations and research, and integrating multidisciplinary strategies to improve people's diet and nutritional situation.

The advantage of her degree is that the demand for professionals in her area is high, and the disadvantage is that she doesn't have the necessary funds to buy study materials.  Her dream is to finish studying, and to specialize in nutritional supplements for athletes.  She wants to buy a laptop computer to  continue her studies and finish her degree.  This is her first sequence of loans with this institution in the 2 years that she has been studying to become a professional.  

For these reasons, Rocio is requesting a loan to buy a personal computer to continue her professional studies and specialize in sports nutrition.

loans.use: to buy a personal computer to continue her professional studies and specialize in sports nutrition

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en: Carmencita is a 59-year-old woman who has owned a small sari-sari (variety) store for 10 years. She lives in Ormoc City, Leyte, Philippines. Her business consists of selling personal products and food like rice, sugar, oil, beans, soda, and other snack foods. The business is the source of her daily income. Carmencita needs to make further investments in her store; however, she lacks the funds to do so. Carmencita is requesting a loan to buy additional items to sell such as soft drinks, shampoo, rice and soap. With the loan, Carmencita will be able to augment her inventory to attract more customers, thus giving her the chance of increasing her sales. She hopes to make her business grow and become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.es:
Jose tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su familia en el distrito de Nueva Arica, en una zona rural que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios agrícolas como peón, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 4 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de nuevas herramientas así como para brindar mantenimiento al lugar donde las guarda, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con esto el espera mejorar la productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 22 years old, is single and lives with his family in the district of Nueva Arica, in a rural zone that is dedicated to agriculture and livestock. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru. 

Jose makes a living providing agricultural services as a laborer, with his own tools and with more than 4 years old experience in the business and good personal and work references in the district. He is requesting a loan to buy new tools as well as to provide maintenance to the place where they are kept. This loan will serve to keep his equipment and tools in better condition, and with this he hopes to improve the productivity of his services and so be able to attend to the diverse needs of his customers in the area. This will generate higher revenues and will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase new tools as well as to provide maintenance to the place where they are are kept.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Leticia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She runs a food vending business in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy ingredients for her business. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling personal care products. Leticia dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en: Tamar is 53 years old. She lives in Baghdati district. Tamar owns a vineyard and produces wine and vodka at a good price to sell locally . She wants to start an additional husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1900 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a cow and will start producing dairy products. This will give her more income and she will be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start producing dairy products

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a married woman. She is 44 years old.

Zosima has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Zosima has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Zosima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gloria Suzette

texts.en:
Gloria Suzette is 59 years old and married. Gloria Suzette works very hard to provide for the family.

Gloria Suzette runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries.

Gloria Suzette has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Gloria Suzette would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Noemi Magdalena

texts.es:
Noemí de 26 años de edad, estudió hasta 5º grado, es madre soltera de 3 hijos y se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.

Noemí se dedica a cuidar niños, decidió realizar este trabajo por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos, pues no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie y tiene que sacarlos adelante sola.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una cocina para elaborar pupusas, es una nueva idea de negocio que ha pensado y su madre le va a ayudar.

Ella espera que funcione la pupuseria que va a abrir y obtener ganancias a lo largo del tiempo.
texts.en:
Noemí is 26 years old and went to school through 5th grade. She is a single mother of three children who are in school. 

Noemí works in childcare services. She decided to do this job out of the need to maintain her family, as she cannot count on help from anyone else and she has to bring them up alone. 

She needs the loan to purchase a stove to make pupusas. It is a new business idea that she has thought of and her mother is going to help her. 

She hopes that the pususa restaurant she is going to open works out and can be profitable in the long run.

loans.use: to purchase a stove to make pupusas

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
María de 31 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja es jornalero, han procreado dos hijos que están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.


María trabaja en casa cuidando a dos niños, además en su casa tiene cerdos que engorda y luego los vende, su madre es quien la ha motivado a trabajar en dicha crianza púes es un ingreso extra para el hogar.


Ella está solicitando este crédito para comprar 3 cerdos, engordarlos y luego venderlos y de esta forma obtener ganancias.

Ella sueña con seguir trabajando, pues tiene muchos deseos de superación y únicamente puede salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo ya que son sus hijos quienes la impulsan a seguir adelante.
texts.en:
María, age 31, is in a relationship, and her life partner works as a day laborer.  They have two children who go to the community school.

María works at home taking care of two children.  She also has pigs at her house.  She fattens them and then sells them.  Her mother is the one who has motivated her to work raising pigs.  It is an extra income for the household.

She is requesting this loan to buy three pigs, to fatten them, and to then sell them.  This way she gets earnings.

She dreams of continuing to work.  She has a big desire to improve herself.  She is only able to get ahead with a great deal of effort.  It is her children who drive her to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy three pigs, to fatten them, and to then sell them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year's tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom, 21, lives in a rural area of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and has one child. To make a living, she works as a garment worker, while her husband helps to earn additional income by farming rice. Having been in this business for 3 years, she can earn about 15USD per day to support her family’s need.
 
Sreymom is new with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy cows for supporting her farming business and will use a portion of it on buying a solar panel. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy cows for supporting her farming business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more medicines, like anti-malaria medicine, to sell to customers.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat is a young and hardworking woman. She is 22 years old and lives with her husband, mother-in-law, father-in-law, brother-in-law and sister-in-law in the district of Vose. 

Saodat with her family is engaged in beekeeping. It is their legacy activity and the main source of income for them. The beekeeping activity is very difficult, but thanks to Saodat and her family's hard work, it brings good profit. 

The purpose of getting a loan is that Saodat wants to increase the count of bees and purchase a few boxes for bees. Their own capital is not enough; that's why Saodat applied for a loan. She hopes for your assistance.

loans.use: to increase the count of bees and purchase a few boxes for bees

loans.name: Hafez

texts.en:
Hafez is a 53-year-old married father of one child and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, almost a year ago he opened an electronics shop in an attempt to increase his income and cover the increasing needs of his family.

Today, Hafez is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business and buy new electronics to satisfy his customers with a wide range of products.

Hafez hopes to expand his business more in the future to stay capable of improving his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy new electronics to satisfy his customers with a wide range of products.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 24-year-old married mother of one child. Two years ago, she opened a clothing shop to help her husband in covering the necessary increasing needs of their child.

Faten is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her customers. Today, she is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open shoe section in her shop. This loan is very important to Faten, for it will help her satisfy her customers' needs and attract new ones.

Faten hopes to expand her business more in the future and open another branch to increase her income and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to open a shoe section in her shop

loans.name: Taron

texts.en:
Taron is a farmer and has been involved in horticulture and land cultivation for many years. Taron, his wife, mother and 24-years-old son live in Gyumri town. His son drives a taxi to support the family's living, and Taron's wife helps her husband with farming works. They keep 450 chickens and also cultivate wheat.

It is very difficult for a family like this to cover their basic costs and at the same time to save money for the development of their business. All resources are used for covering daily needs and nothing remains for the development of the farm. All Taron needs is financial support to purchase feed for the chickens, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation.

Taron's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

Taron relies on lenders' goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for chicken feed, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation.

loans.name: Leolita

texts.en:
Leolita is 41 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Leolita works very hard to provide for them.

Leolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries.

Leolita has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Leolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelita is 50 years old now.

Angelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Angelita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sesa's Group

texts.en:
Sesa, 30, is a married mother of a small child, living in Siem Reap province.  Rice farming, potato farming and working for other farms for payment are the sources of her family’s income for ages. These earns her about 25,000KHR per day. 

Now she lacks funds to support her farm.  She has decided to lead a group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She will use her loan portion to buy seeds, pay for labor and a plowing fee. She hopes to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pay for labor and a plowing fee

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Antonia is 58 years old and has one child in school.

Antonia has a food-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Antonia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Antonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Neur

texts.en:
Ner, 37, comes from Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working as a garment worker for 19 years. She can earn about 30,000KHR per day.

Neur is in her first cycle with VisionFund.  She is applying for a loan to buy cows to help her in earning more income, so as to better off her family living condition.

loans.use: to buy cows to improve her family income

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Kabelo

texts.en: Kabelo is applying for a second loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the first loan: “Since my first loan from Kiva, my studies been progressing very well because a Kiva loan has eased my financial constraints in terms of paying for my tuition fees; it has also helped me to come to school.”

loans.use: to pay for one year's tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a married woman with eight children. Cristita is 52 years old and has three children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cristita has a mat weaving business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business like coconut leaves, etc.

Cristita has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Cristita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coconut leaves needed for her mat weaving business.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 61 years old and married.

Carmencita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Carmencita has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmencita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Elvina Cecilia

texts.es: Elvina a sus 59 años de edad, desde la comodidad de su hogar ofrece servicios de alquiler de lavadoras y café internet. Inició alquilando lavadoras por su propia iniciativa, luego un familiar le recomendó que también colocara un café internet por no existir éste negocio en el barrio donde vive y la comunidad demandaba de los servicios de transcripción, servicio de navegación e impresión.   Elvina es muy dedicada y  comprometida con sus negocios,  todos los días del año los habitantes del municipio de Baranoa en el Atlántico pueden contar con estos servicios en el horario de 8 a.m. a 8 p.m.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar computadores y compensar la afluencia de personal que ingresa al local.  Esta inversión favorecerá la capacidad de su negocio, lo que mejora el indicador de servicio: más clientes atendidos, más clientes satisfechos y una inversión recuperada más ágilmente. Su meta familiar es hacerle adecuaciones a su vivienda para lograr una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo también a sus locales comerciales.
texts.en:
Elvina is 59 years old and runs a laundromat and internet cafe from the comfort of her home.  She started the laundromat by her own initiative, and later, a family member recommended that she also put in an internet cafe because there weren't any in the neighborhood where she lives and there was demand in the community for word processing, internet browsing, and printing services.  

Elvina is very dedicated and committed to her business.  Every day of the year, the residents of Baranoa en el Atlántico can count on her services from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  Presently, she is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first loan that she is requesting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy computers and accommodate the large number of people who come into her internet cafe.  

This investment will increase the capacity of her business, and lead to improvements in one indicator of service:  namely, more clients served, more clients satisfied, and an investment recuperated more quickly.  Her goal for her family is to renovate her home so that they can have a better quality of life, and her goal for her business is the same.

loans.use: to buy computers to accommodate the large amount of people who come into her internet cafe

loans.name: Nkululeko

texts.en: Nkululeko is applying for a third loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the second loan: “Since I have been on the Kiva loan, I have since not have had to worry about taxi fare to school. I do not have any parents or legal guardian to finance my tuition fees; therefore, Kiva has helped me in this regard. I am grateful for what this organization has done for me and I am now on my final year. Thank you!"

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Moul's Group

texts.en:
Moul, 50, is a rice farmer living in Siem Reap province, and a father of four children. To overcome his family’s hardship, he has been in this kind of business for ages, and it earns him about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Due to natural disaster, his crops are not growing well, so his income is also decreased. Now, he is leading a group to apply for this loan and will use his portion to buy seeds and pay for the plowing fee. He hopes that through this loan, he will have enough money to do the farm and earn more money to expand his current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for the plowing fee

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Phoern

texts.en:
Phoern, 47, is residing in Kampong Siem district of kampong Cham province. She has six children, one of whom is still in school. She is a housewife, while her husband works hard as a house construction worker.  Sometimes he works as a motor-taxi driver to earn additional income for supporting his family. The current business earns her family about 30,000KHR per day.
 
This is her third cycle for Phoern with VisionFund. Now she is applying for another loan to spend on buying cows and repairing her old motorbike. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her farmland, to increase her rice farming production to make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to use on buying cows and repairing her motorbike.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana de 48 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en una empresa distribuidora de agua, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad pero aún viven en casa.


Ana se dedica a oficios domésticos, su esposo y sus hijos le ayudan económicamente, pues a pesar de que sus hijos viven en casa, trabajan para ayudarle a su madre.

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar electrodomésticos como licuadora, plancha, etc. que son necesarios en su hogar, desea comprarlos al contado ya que al crédito resultan mas caros.

Ana sueña día con día con lograr cosas nuevas, entre sus propósitos está montar algún negocio para ayudarle a su esposo e hijos con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ana is 48 years old and she never had the opportunity to study.  She lives with her partner who works in a business that distributes water.  She has three children who are adults but they still live at home. 

Ana works in the home. Her husband and children help her economically, since while her children live at home they work in order to support her. 

She needs a loan in order to purchase items such as a blender, an iron, etc. that are necessary for her home.  She wants to purchase them with cash since loans for such purchases are more expensive.  

Ana dreams of one day achieving new things.  Among her goals are things like beginning her own business in order to help her husband and children with household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase items such as a blender, an iron, etc. that are necessary for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy boxes of cooking oil, super glue and tomato paste to sell to customers

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities ranging from noodles, cooking oil, biscuits and canned goods to toiletries. She is a 38-year-old, married woman with no dependents from Mcarthur, Leyte. She has been running a sari-sari store for three years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted goods for the store, like beverages, seasonings and soft drinks. These will improve the contents of her store and cause her to attract more buyers to come and shop. With these, her income will slowly improve and she will able to handle her finances.

Agnes is hoping that she could successfully handle and expand her business to become sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods for the store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristita is 56 years old now.

Cristita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Cristita has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Cristita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Amado De Jesus

texts.es:
Amado es un hombre de 55 años de edad, es sonriente, trabajador, cordial, aunque tiene un dolor en el alma el cual se lo genero la muerte de su esposo, una marca que queda para siempre, Amado luego de este acontecimiento se refugió mucho en su trabajo ya que lo mantenía entretenido y podía socializar con muchas personas y aún más sabiendo que tiene 4 hijos por los cuales trabajar, luchar y superarse.


Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, en la zona de abejorral, su tienda es básica pero tiene estanterías y vitrinas para trabajar solo que la falta de capital para abastecerla lo ha tenido muy frenado, como se puede ver en la foto sus estanterías se encuentra vacías y por ello acude a ustedes buscando un aliento económico que le permita comprar surtido de la canasta familiar para surtir todo su negocio, entre lo comprado necesita panela, arroz, chocolate, aceite, sal, azúcar, productos de aseo, desodorantes, papel higiénico, límpido,  quesito, leche, entre otros.

Tu préstamo permitirá a  Amado tomar un segundo respiro en su negocio para salir con fuerza a vender buscando mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, que es quizás lo que su esposa hubiera deseado.
texts.en:
Amado is a 55-year-old man. He is smiley, hard-working, and kind even though his heart is missing a piece: his wife has passed away, and this will leave a permanent mark on him. After her death, Amado took refuge in his work. It keeps him busy and he is able to socialize with many people. What's more, he has four children to support and work for.
Amado sells groceries in the Abejorral zone. His store is basic but he has stands and display cases. A lack of capital to stock these displays has held him back. As can be seen in the photo, his display cases are empty. For this reason, he is looking for a loan to allow him to stock his business with items such as: bread, rice, chocolate, oil, salt, sugar, toiletries, deodorants, toilet paper, cleaning supplies, cheese, and milk.
Your loan will bring new life to Amado's business so that he can put his best foot forward, working to improve his family's living conditions as his wife would have wanted.

loans.use: to buy stock: bread, rice, chocolate, oil, salt, sugar, toiletries, deodorants, toilet paper, cleaning supplies, cheese, milk, and others.

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es:
Felipe es un hombre de 52 años de edad, un hombre trabajador, que con lo poco que tiene lo pone a producir en bien de su familia, se dedica al alquiler de lavadoras una actividad muy común en la zona de Sincelejo que es el sector donde reside.

Su negocio como no tiene una fecha establecida y lo tiene en casa trata de trabajarlo todo el tiempo que pueda, hasta que se sienta realmente exhausto y necesite dormir, gracias a esta actividad logra generar alimentar a su familia que la conforma tres hijos y su pareja, pero algo que lo tiene muy motivado es el crecimiento y la demanda que tiene, por ello necesita aprovechar el buen momento e invertir en la compra de más lavadoras para ampliar su cobertura.

Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, estucarla, pintarla, cambiar algunos bienes, tener una casa cómoda y dar ejemplo a sus hijos de como un hombre con ganas de progresar puede lograr buenas cosas honestamente.
texts.en:
Felipe is a 52-year-old man. He is a hard worker, and he has put the small amount that he has to work for the good of his family. He rents washing machines, which is a very common business in the Sincelejo zone where he lives.
His business does not have established hours and is run from his home. He works there whenever he can, until he feels truly exhausted and needs to sleep. Thanks to this work, he has been able to feed his family: three children and his wife. A big motivation for him is the growth and demand for his business. He needs to take advantage of this good moment to invest in the purchase of more washers to expand his service.
His dream is to improve his home's conditions. To finish it, paint it, change some items, and to have a comfortable home. He wants to be an example to his children of how a man with a desire to get ahead can achieve good things honestly.

loans.use: to buy washing machines.

loans.name: Zoilo Gervacio

texts.es:
Zoilo es un hombre de 40 años de edad, un hombre que es casado, padre de dos hijos una de 5 y otro de 7, ellos son su motor de vida, los que le dan fuerza y alegran en las noches cuando llega. Él es muy trabajador y responsable, todo lo que genera lo destina para sus familias, su negocio de ferretería es la única entrada de dinero y en ello pone todo el futuro de sus hijas y como está jugando con el futuro de las dos personas que más ama tiene que hacer todo lo posible para que dicho negocio sea un éxito y se mantenga con el pasar del tiempo.

Zoilo quiere solicitar un préstamo para tener una nueva línea de venta en su negocio, el préstamo será destinado en su totalidad para la compra de repuestos de motocicleta, como lubricantes, aceite, bombillas, pastas, cables, retrovisores.
texts.en:
Zoilo is a 40-year-old man, married with two daughters ages 5 and 7. They are his life's engine; they give him strength and joy in the evenings when he gets home. He is very hard-working and responsible. He gives his family everything he earns. He has a hardware store, and it is the only source of income for his family. His daughters' futures are dependent on this business. Because the futures of the two people he loves most are involved here, he has to do everything possible for his business to succeed and continue in the future.
Zoilo wants to request a loan to start a new sales line in his business. He will use all of this loan to purchase spare parts for motorcycles, such as lubricants, oil, pumps, moulds, cables, and rear mirrors.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Zulma Esmaralda

texts.es:
Zulma, de 32 años de edad, toda su vida se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, está acompañada, tiene tres hijos los cuales están estudiando.

Zulma, tiene cinco años de dedicarse a la venta de panes, de esa manera obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

Ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar otro carretón para poner otra venta de panes en otro lugar, ya que de esa manera podrá obtener un poco más de ganancias y le dará empleo a alguien más.

Zulma, sueña con tener su propio cafetín para poder vender variedades de panes y tener muchos clientes y ayudar a su hijo, para que sigan estudiando y puedan ser unas personas de bien en la vida.
texts.en:
Zulma is 32 years old. She has made a living housekeeping for her entire life, since she didn't have the opportunity to go to school.  She is in a relationship and has 3 children who are in school.  

Zulma has been selling bread for 3 years, and this is how she makes enough income to cover her family's necessities.  

She is applying for a loan to buy another cart to sell bread in another location, since this will allow her to make a little more profit and employ another person.  

Zulma's dream is to have her own small cafe so that she can sell a variety of bread and have a lot of customers, and to help her children so that they continue studying and become good people.

loans.use: to buy another food cart to sell bread at another location

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Siempre sonriente, amigable, dispuesto a darlo todo en el trabajo, ese Andres un hombre soltero de 36 años de edad que se dedica a la fabricación de alimentos, tiene todas las instalaciones en su casa, los implementos y la indumentaria para cumplir a cabalidad con las normas mínimas de higiene solicitadas por las entidades pertinentes.

A pesar de ser soltero es un padre muy responsable que cada que gana dinero piensa en sus hijos, tiene uno de 16 y otra 6, son su razón de trabajar y de querer progresar.

Su principal sueño es poder comprar una vivienda propia, por ello se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual quiere destinar a la reactivación de su negocio, ya que lo paro de momento por atender asuntos familiares.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar embudos, un molino eléctrico, madeja, carne, químicos.

Tu apoyo será muy importante puesto que le permitirá al empresario reactivar el negocio y comprar la maquinaria que en un momento tuvo que comprar dar cara a la eventualidad familiar que se le presento.
texts.en:
Always smiling, kind, and disposed to give everything to his work, Andrés is a single 36 year old man who works making food.  He has all the equipment in his home, the implements and attire necessary to meet the requirements for hygiene outlined by the pertinent authorities.  

Despite being single, he is a responsible father who thinks of his children, ages 16 and 6, whenever he makes money.  They are his reason for working and for wanting to progress. 

His main dream is to be able to purchase his own home.  

He is requesting a loan which will be used to reactivate his business, since he has stopped for the moment in order to attend to family issues. 

With the loan he wants to purchase casings for sausages, an electric grinder, yarn or string, meat, and preservatives.  Your support will be very important since it will permit him to reactivate his business and purchase items that he had at one time but that due to family circumstances he now needs to replace.

loans.use: to purchase casings for sausages, an electric grinder, yarn or string, meat, and preservatives.

loans.name: Berfalia

texts.es:
Berfalia de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, el hijo trabaja adiestrando caballos y la hija ya está casada, de Berfalia solo depende su hijo menor el cual está estudiando bachillerato.

Berfalia se dedica a destazar cerdos, ya que fue una actividad que aprendió de su madre el cual ahora le genera sus ingresos económicos, solamente su hijo menor se involucra en el trabajo de manera que juntos luchan pasa salir adelante. 

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar tres cerdos y destazarlos para así vender la carne y generar ganancias para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.

Como toda madre que quiere lo mejor para su hijo, ella sueña con apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios para que sea un buen porofesional.
texts.en:
Berfalia is 40 years old and studied until the 7th grade.  She is a single mother of 3 children.  Her son trains horses and her daughter is married.  Only her youngest son is dependent on her, and he is in high school.  

Berfalia makes a living butchering pigs, since she learned the profession from her mother and now it allows her to earn a living.  Only her youngest son is involved in the work, and together they are fighting to get ahead in life.  

She needs the loan to buy 3 pigs to butcher and sell the meat to cover the necessities of her household.

Like any mother, she wants the best for her son, and her dream is to support her children in their studies so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy 3 pigs to butcher and sell the meat to cover the necessities of her household

loans.name: Yanira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yanira es una joven de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta 5º grado, está acompañada y  su pareja trabaja de albañil y también cultiva maíz, tienen solo un hijo que ya estudia en la escuela.
 
Desde que se acompañó, Yanira quiso ayudarle a su pareja a obtener otros  ingresos, fue por eso que decidió dedicarse a la crianza de cerdos, ella los engorda y luego los vende además cría aves de corral que también le genera ganancias cuando las vende.


Yanira solicita el préstamo para comprar concentrado para los cerdos y vacunas para que sus animales estén en buenas condiciones y poder ganar más por ellos.

Su sueño es tener una granja grande para resguardar sus cerdos y a las aves de corral y que su negocio sea muy rentable.
texts.en:
Yanira is a young 25 yeard old woman who studied until 5th grade and. She is married and her partner works as a bricklayer and also cultivates maize, together they have one child who is already studying at school. 

Since she got married, Yanira wanted to help her partner to gain more income, this is why she decided to work raising pigs, she grows them and later sells them, she also breeds poultry which she sells to make money. 

Yanira is asking for loan to purchase feed concentrate and vaccines for the pigs, so that her animals are in good condition and she will be able to earn more from them. 

Her dream is to have a large farm to keep her pigs and poultry, and that her business is profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate and vaccines for pigs so that her animals are in good condition

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
Chin lives in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 57 years old and married with four children. 

To support her family, she has been working as a farmer by growing rice and cassava for 39 years. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day to make a living, and she can afford to save 35,000 KHR each day after expenses. Low crop yield has still been a challenge for her business. 

This is Chin’s group loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, and she has just joined VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group of five female members to apply for a loan. Chin will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living and afford to buy some household necessities for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Chanda's Group

texts.en:
Chanda, 26, is a rice and potato farmer living in Siem Reap province. He has one child. He has been involved in this business for a long time and it earns him about 20,000KHR per day. He now has not enough funds to support the farm, so he decided to lead this group, to take a loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. 

He will use his loan portion to buy seed and pay for plowing fees. He hopes his family’s living condition will be improved through this loan.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay for plowing fees

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Chreb, 34, resides in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with three dependent children. For more than ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava as primary sources of the family’s income. They can earn about KHR30,000 per day and manage to save about 20,000 each day for their future needs. 

Chreb is in her first cycle with VisionFund. She is asking for a loan to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is a 32-year-old married woman residing in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte.  She owns a sari-sari (variety) store, selling commodities like sugar, biscuits, chips, soap, shampoo and canned goods. She has been engaged in running a store for two years now.

Epifania has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy assorted goods for the store, like sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks and toiletries. This inventory is essential to augmenting her income. With these goods, she could offer a variety of goods and attract more buyers to her shop. She could start to balance her finances and settle her obligations.

She dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods for the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Cindy works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell home care products business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling fruits.

Cindy is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap powder, etc., for her home care products business.

Cindy has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap powder, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 46 years old and widowed with four children. With one child in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for the family.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Samean

texts.en:
Samean, 30, living in Battambang province, is a mother of three children. Two of her children are in school, and the other one is too young to get in school.

Her family’s living is dependent on growing rice on four hectares of farmland, sesame farming on two hectares of farmland, and working for other farms. She has been involved in these businesses for ten years, and it earns her about 45,200 KHR per day.

In order to fulfill her dream to have a better house to live in, she has decided to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to rebuild her old house. She hopes her family will have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to rebuild her old house

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi lives in the Batumi district. He is 59 years old and lives with his wife. Giorgi is, at the moment, unemployed. The only source of income for the family is the monthly salary of his wife, who works as an operator at a local taxi company. The family lives in poverty. 

The Start Up Program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 600 USD. Giorgi purchased a car, but he needs money to pay the toll for it. After the tax is paid he will offer a service to local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the tax for his car, so he will be able to begin using it to provide taxi services

loans.name: Kimang's Group

texts.en:
Aged 61 years, Kimang is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children. She earns a living through farming rice and growing soybeans, which she had been doing for 43 years. She can earn about KHR 56,000 per day from the current business and is able to save about KHR 3,000 each day for the future. 

This is the sixth loan for Kimang with VisionFund. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Aslia

texts.en:
Aslia is 48 years old with 6 children, who are all in school. 

Her husband helps her in their business of RTW (buying and selling of clothes). Their business is their bread and butter which helps with their expenses and children's education.

Her RTW (buying and selling clothes) started with a capital of PHP 6,500 from their savings. She bought t-shirts, blouses and shorts and sold them in a customized stall on the street. Since the location was popular and the prices lower than the other stores, it was well patronized and items sold easily. 

Through hard work and a series of loans, Aslia was able to rent a place to display her clothes and has regular customers buying her clothes in bulk.

Now Aslia is earning a net of PHP 25,000 monthly, with a much larger stock and employs 1 helper in the store. 

Aslia wants to expand her store and add more stock. Specially now that people are demanding summer clothes, since the weather in the Philippines is getting hotter.

Aslia is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 80,000 to buy 24 pairs of shorts, 24 cotton shirts, 24 sleeveless undershirts and 24 cotton blouses as additional items she can sell in her clothing store.

Aslia wants to expand her store into a wholesale clothing store someday, to not just help her in their expenses, but most of all, for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy many items of summer clothing as additional items she can sell in her clothing store.

loans.name: Leidy Johana

texts.es:
Leidy es una joven de 19 años de edad, ella trabajadora, comprometida con su hija de 10 meses de edad y en el momento se encuentra esperando su segundo hijo, es una madre cabeza de hogar que con su venta de helados trata de sacar su familia delante y ser lo mejor madre del mundo para sus hijos.

Ella abandono sus estudios para poder trabajar para alimentar a sus dos niños, su pareja la abandono, está sola pero esta situación para ella es fortaleza para salir adelante, cuenta con amigos y familiares que siempre la alienta, la reemplazan, le cuidan al niño.

Ella tiene sueños para su familia los cuales son comprar una vivienda propia, pagar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar las condiciones en su hogar, solo le queda trabajar y ruega porque su en nuevo embarazo todo salga muy bien.

Solicita un préstamo para surtir su negocio con sabores de helados, compra crema chantilly, barquillos, conchas para helados.
texts.en:
Leidy is a  hard working 19 year old, she is hard working and is committed to caring for her 10 month old child, she is currently awaiting the birth of her second child. She is the head of the household and with her sales of ice cream she tries to help her family move forward and to be the best mother in the world for her children. 

She left he studies  to be able to work in order to feed her two children, her partner left her and she is now single but she will be strong and move forward from this. She relies on friends and family who always encourage her and help care for the child. 

She has dreams of buying her own home for her family, to pay for her children's' education, and to improve the conditions of her home. All that is left for her is to work and to pray that everything goes well with her pregnancy. 

She is asking for a loan to supply her business with different flavoured ice creams, whipped cream, wafers, and ice cream cones

loans.use: supply her shop with different flavoured ice creams, whipped cream, wafers, and ice cream cones

loans.name: Zuhroi

texts.en:
Zuhroi is a young and sociable girl who is 23 years old. She lives with her parents and sisters in the city of Dushanbe.

Zuhroi does not have a high education. After graduating from secondary school, she began to sew traditional women's dresses. Zuhroi is very happy because she can earn a living. She sews very beautiful traditional women's dresses and has many customers. She works carefully.
