Currently Zuhroi is not able to work well because her sewing machine is broken. She wants to buy a new sewing machine. Her main problem is lack of money.

Zuhroi hopes that with the help of Kiva and its lenders, she will be able to purchase a new sewing machine and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Anunciacion

texts.en:
Anunciacion, 60, is a resident from the town of Tanauan. Leyte. She has 10 children. One of them is still attending school.  She operates a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells goods like biscuits, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, and toiletries. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock for the store. This will improve the variety of goods at hand and will also  attract more buyers to come. Her income will improve and she could later handle her finances. She could now provide her family with good food and better shelter to live in.

With this loan, she is  determined to handle her business successfully for a brighter future ahead.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the store

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 55 years old and widowed with seven children. With two children in school, Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home care products  and other groceries.

She has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home  care products and other groceries

loans.name: Engelyn

texts.en:
Engelyn is 53 years old and married with three children. Engelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Engelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Engelyn has been in this business for 18 years now. 

In the future, Engelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Arpenik

texts.en:
Arpenik always knew that she and her husband wanted to have a big and profitable farm. So, while their two sons grew up, they began their agribusiness. Currently their farm includes three cows, two calves and twenty hens. Arpenik also cultivates potato and cabbage.

They work very hard to have a successful farm that will provide them a stable monthly income. All Arpenik needs now is some financial resources to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer and to pay for renovation of the barn. The loan will be a big support, enabling Arpenik to improve and expand her farm.

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor and the unemployment rate there is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Arpenik's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer, and renovation of the barn

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Elma is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more used clothes to sell for her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a widowed woman with 11 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gloria is 67 years old now.

Gloria has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell .

Gloria has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in Amasia village of Shirak region, with her newborn daughter, husband and parents-in-law. She started to help her husband with farming activities when they got married.
 
The family's farm includes livestock of 12 cows, 2 calves and 12 pigs. Meat and milk produced in the farm, Hasmik and her husband sell in the local bazaar, so the family have an income for living. 

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. 

Hasmik's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for forage (barley and corn) for feeding her livestock

loans.name: Taing Kea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Taing Kea is 48-year-old widowed mother of three children. She is a farmer who has been growing cassava and rice for five years. She can make a daily income from her current business of 40,000KHR and is able to save about 20,000KHR per day after expenses for her future needs.

This is the sixth loan for Taing Kea with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Arley De Jesus

texts.es:
Arley es un campesino de 27 años de edad, con su fuerza, pujante, responsabilidad, honestidad y cordialidad que caracteriza a las personas del campo, se dedica al cultivo de frutas, actualmente tiene 200 palos de granadilla una fruta exquisita muy típica en Colombia, inicio hace poco, junto unos ahorros y su padre le ayudo a comprar el terreno con los palos, los consiguió a un buen precio, su negocio nació de la necesidad de conseguir recursos para mantener a su hijo de 4 años de edad y tiene un gran propósito que es tener una finca, solo le queda trabajar y esperar que el tiempo le sonría para alcanzar sus propósitos.

Como está empezando necesita impulsos, en el momento solicita de un aliento económico para la compra de abonos y riegos, insumos principales en los cultivos.
texts.en:
Arley is a 27 years old farmer. He is among the farmers who stand out for their strength, vigor, responsibility, honesty and friendliness. He makes his living growing fruits. He currently has 200 passion fruit trees. Passion fruit is delicious and very typical fruit in Colombia. 

He recently bought the land and the trees with the savings and help from his father. He got a good price for them. He started his business to raise funds to raise his 4 year old son.  His farm serves a great purpose to reach his goals.

As it is gaining momentum, Arley requests a loan to purchase fertilizers and irrigation which are the main inputs for the crops.

loans.use: requests a loan to purchase fertilizers and irrigation

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra una trabajadora innata, emprendedora, gustosa del trabajo independiente, madre amorosa, virtuosa, con carisma para atender a la gente, con un sentido de responsabilidad y de rectitud muy alto que se dedica a atender un negocio de heladería, el cual atiende 10 horas diarias, aprendió sola, tiene una persona preparando los helados y ella hace las labores de mesera, de limpiadora, de administradora, de jefe, en verdad se pone en las pies del trabajador.

Ella inicio su negocio con la idea de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, su hija que ya tiene 8 años de edad crece a pasos agigantados y cada día se van presentando necesidad y ella quiere estar para suplirlas.

Sabiendo que los helados por tradición ha sido un lugar para compartir con la pareja, quiere solicitar un préstamo para sacar nuevos sabores y preparaciones llamativas enfocadas en el tema del noviazgo, realizara adecuaciones locativas, como pegar adhesivos y pintar para ambientar el local, el resto será para comprar surtido de helado.
texts.en:
Sandra is naturally hard-working and enterprising. She loves working independently. She is a loving, virtuous mother who has good charisma for customer service. She has a sense of responsibility and high morals. She has an ice cream shop, which she tends to ten hours per day. She learned this work on her own. She has one employee to prepare the ice cream, and she attends the tables, cleans, and does the administrative work. She is the boss but truly puts herself in the shoes of the worker.
She started her business with the goal of improving her family's living conditions. Her daughter is now 8 and is growing up very quickly. Every day, new needs present themselves, and Sandra wants to be able to cover them.
Knowing that ice cream is traditionally an item bought in pairs, she wants to take out a loan to stock new flavours and start a campaign aimed at sweethearts. She will put up posters and paint the store, and buy ice cream stock.

loans.use: to buy new flavours and start an ad campaign.

loans.name: Maritza Estela

texts.es:
Maritza una mujer de 30 años que se dedica a ofertar servicio de salón de belleza, donde genera un empleo se encuentra solicitando su ayuda para complementar sus servicios ofertando en su salón de belleza productos de cuidado de cabello, tinturas, tratamientos, gel, esmaltes entre otros productos.

La necesidad surge de los clientes quienes le sugirieron que tuviera a la venta los productos que le aplican para ellos poder comprarlos y seguir con un tratamiento es por ello que quiere comprar surtido y una vitrina para exhibirlos.

Una entrada extra de dinero nunca cae mal y esto le puede ayudar a la consecución de su sueño que es comprar casa.
texts.en:
Maritza is a 30 year old woman who earns a living from her beauty salon. She is asking for help in order to complement her services offered in the salon, with hair beauty products, dyes, treatments, gels, and nail polishes amongst other things

The need arises from customers who suggested that she sells the products she uses for them, so that they can buy them and continue with a treatment. This is why she wants to buy an assortment of products and a cabinet to display them. 

An extra source of income is never a bad thing, and this may help her to achieve her dream of buying a house.

loans.use: to buy a selection of hair products, dyes, treatments, gels, and nail polishes amongst other things

loans.name: Luz Angela

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer humilde y trabajadora de 28 años de edad, ella es residente en Santa Fe de Antioquia, vive junto con su pareja con la cual tiene tres hijos de 9, 8 y 2 años de edad, ambos son jóvenes, su esposo gana un salario mínimo vigente, como no era lo suficiente para el mantenimiento de su familia por ello, esta valiente mujer tomo al decisión de buscar alguna forma de generar ingresos por ello optó por el camino más fácil el cual era vender mercancía puesto que no necesitaba mucha experiencia solo un espíritu fuerte, una gran sonrisa y decisión para triunfar.

Luz vende ropa para todo sexo y edad, lo hace por encargos, de momento se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para sacar una nueva colección de ropa  para mostrar, busca atraer mas clientes y retomar clientes antiguos.
texts.en:
Luz is a humble and hard working 28 year old woman, she is a resident of Santa Fe de Antioquia and lives with her partner and their three children of 9, 8 and 2 years old. Her partner is also young and earns a minimum salary which is not enough to maintain their family. 

This brave woman made the decision to find a way to earn more money. She opted for the easy route which was to sell merchandise because she didn't need much experience, just a strong spirit, a big smile and the decision to succeed. 

Luz sells clothes for all ages and sexes, she does it for commission. At the moment she is asking for a loan to get a new collection of clothes to display, she is looking to attract more clients and regain old clients.

loans.use: to have a new collection of clothing for men and women that she can exhibit

loans.name: Noeun's Group

texts.en:
Noeun, 57, living in Battambang province, is the mother of nine children. Rice farming and feeding pigs are the sources of her family’s income for twelve years. Through these businesses, she can earn about 104,000KHR per day to support her family. 

Due to a lack of funds, she is now leading a group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. She will use her loan portion to buy pig feed to support her current business. She hopes that she will earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
La is living in Battambang province and is a widowed mother of four children.

Her family’s living depends on growing rice on three hectares of farmland and working for other farms for a fee. She has been involved in this business for ten years, and it earns her about 41,700 KHR per day.

Due to a lack of funds, she is now applying for a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer and to hire workers to work on her farm. She hopes to earn more money to improve her standard of living through this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to hire a worker.

loans.name: Soheng's Group

texts.en:
Soheng, 29, lives in the province of Battambang. She is a mother of a child who still depends on her. Rice farming, feeding pigs and working for other farms have been the sources of her family’s income for five years. Through these income sources, she can earn about 63,600KHR per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group of two to apply for this loan. With her portion, she will buy pig feed and pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more money and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia runs a sari-sari( variety) store. She sells various items ranging from soft drinks, chips, bread, noodles, canned goods and toiletries. She is  married woman with three dependents ages 23, 20 and 18.  She has been engaged in her sari-sari(variety) store for 10 years already.

She is asking for a loan to purchase a variety of goods for the store, such as beverages, condiments and other assorted goods. In this way, it will help Cresencia filled her store again. Thus it enables her to attract more buyers. 

With the additional capital, she is eager to expand her business for the welfare of her children and also for the improvement of her family's living condition.

loans.use: to  purchase a variety of goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 49-year-old man. He has a lovely family; he has two daughters and a son, who is a help to Ali in his business. His wife is a housewife. 

Ali’s elder daughter is 20 years old. His little daughter is 17 years old and goes to the tenth class. His family are IDP (Internally displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now live in the Fuzuli region. 

Ali has been in the animal breeding business. He buys little calves, raises them, and sells them in the bazaar to earn money. Today he wants to increase his business and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy little calves. 

Ali is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy little calves and increase his business; in the future he wants to help his children in education.

loans.name: Immaculada

texts.en:
Immaculada is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Immaculada is 61 years old.

Immaculada has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Immaculada has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Immaculada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 55 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home care products, personal care products and other groceries.

Imelda has been in this business for 30 years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home care products, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María solo estudió hasta 3º grado, está divorciada y solo vive con dos de sus cinco hijos, los otros tres son mayores y han formado sus propios hogares.

A pesar de que María se separó de su esposo, eso no fue ninguna excusa para que ella luchara por sacar adelante a sus hijos por sus propios medios, decidió entonces dedicarse a cultivar maíz, actividad en la cual sus hijos se involucran y además ella vende productos de revistas.

María solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, abono, veneno, etc para la siembra de granos básicos, de esta manera podrá garantizar una producción abundante libre de plagas y la alimentación para sus hijos.

Ella se siente muy satisfecha pues le ha enseñado a sus hijos a trabajar y a ganarse las cosas de buena manera, por lo tanto sueña que sigan así y logren ser personas de bien.
texts.en:
María only attended school until grade 3. She is divorced and lives with two of her five children; three of her children are grown and have their own families.
Even though she is separated from her husband, she is working hard to support her children on her own. She has decided to cultivate corn. Her children help her. She also sells products from magazines.
Maria is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizer, manure, pesticides, and other items for cultivating basic grains. This way, she will be able to guarantee an abundant production, free of pests. This will feed her children.
Maria is very happy, because she has taught her children to work and take care of themselves properly. Her dream is for them to continue in this manner and become good people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides and other items.

loans.name: Maluza

texts.en:
Maluza is a 69 year old married woman. She lives with her pensioner husband in the small village of Senaki district. Maluza has 7 cows and produces cheese to sell. 

She wants to start a trading business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to have a loan of 1500GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of laurel leaves and will resell them at higher price. She is very motivated to increase her family income and hopes that the business will be profitable.  Maluza awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade in laurel leaves

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
Juan Diego es un joven de 23 años de edad, aficionado a las motos, se han el fanatismo por las motocicletas es tanto que quiso que toda su vida girara en torno a ellas, por ello desde su temprana edad hizo un esfuerzo gigante no solo en aprendizaje del arte de la reparación si no también la consolidación de un negocio que le genere ingresos para pagar sus estudios y ayudar en su casa.

Juan Diego tiene une meta mantener su estilo de vida que tanto le gusta, vivir de las motos y juntar capital para comprarse una moto de gama alta, sería un sueño hecho realidad para él.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de mano, copas llaves, caja de herramientas, tendrá todo el equipo para atender la eventualidad que se le presente en su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan Diego is a 23-year-old young man who is a big fan of motorcycles. His love for motorcycles is so great that he wished for his entire life to revolve around them. For this reason, starting at a young age, he made a huge effort not only to learn the art of repair, but also to establish a business in order to earn an income, allowing him to pay for his education and to help with household expenses.

Juan Diego's goal is to maintain his lifestyle, which he greatly enjoys. Making a living from motorcycles and saving enough money to buy himself a high-end motorcycle would be a dream come true for him. 

He is requesting a loan to buy hand tools, a socket wrench set, and a toolbox. This way, he will have all of the equipment necessary to attend to anything that presents itself to his business.

loans.use: to buy hand tools, a socket wrench set, and a toolbox for his motorcycle repair business.

loans.name: Heat's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Heat is 36 years old and married. She has four dependent children. The primary sources of her family’s income are from cassava planting. To better support the family, her husband sometimes works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 2 years, she can earn about 38,000KHR per day. The main challenge for her family’s business is the drop of cassava’s price.

Heat has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve financial burdens. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan to buy a decent motorbike and use some of it to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike and help renovate her old house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Freddy Alonso

texts.es:
Freddy es un personaje de la Ceja, una persona humilde, sonriente pero con su carácter, un hombre con liderazgo, con iniciativa se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino, un negocio aprendido por su padre y con el que ha podido sostener a su familia conformada por tres hijos, una de 15 y dos de 13 y 9, se separó de su esposa por lo que debe trabajar para pagar su vivienda y mandarle a sus hijos cada semana.

Con su negocio se trazó dos objetivos poder pagar uno de ellos pagar la educación de sus hijos y el otro elevar su calidad de vida, ya que como se separó en su casa hay pocas cosas y necesita comprar, ya a largo tiempo su pensando es comprar una vivienda en el campo.


Freddy quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 3 cerdos y su respectivo alimento.

Este préstamo le permitirá mejorar las ventas, aumentar sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad y dar sostenibilidad a su negocio.
texts.en:
Freddy is from la Ceja, he is a humble man, with a quick smile but a strong character, a man with leadership and initiative. He raises pigs, a trade he learned from his father and with which he has been able to support his family of three children, 15, 13, and 9 years old. He is separated from his wife, so he needs to work to pay for the house and to send money for his children every week. 

He has two goals for his business, one is to be able to pay for his children's education, and the other is to improve his quality of life, since he is separated there is not much in his house and he needs to buy things, and over the long term he would like to buy a house in the country. 

Freddy would like to solicit a loan to buy three pigs and feed for them. 

This loan will allow him to improve sales, grow his customer base, grow his business and strengthen its sustainability.

loans.use: to buy three pigs and feed, the loan will help him to improve sales and expand his customer base

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Vicente hails from the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. He is a father of six children, and his oldest child is eight. He is engaged in a hog raising business. In addition to hog raising, he engages in tuba (coconut) wine vending business.

He is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed. These are very important tools to boost Vicente's livelihood. With these inputs, he could raise quality pigs and cause to augment his income. Equipped with these resources, he could expand his business and be able to provide the needs of his family as well.

Vicente hopes that he could continue manage both of his sources of income successfully for brighter future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a farmer who has been raising cattle and cultivating seasonal vegetables for the past several years. His farm is big and currently includes two cows, 20 sheep, hens and some calves. He also cultivates wheat and barley, working day and night to sustain his enterprise. 

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Armen's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

In the photo Armen is shown with his two sons, David and Arsen, of whom he is very proud. Every time he looks into their  eyes, he sees a joyful and happy future.

loans.use: to pay for five piglets and forage to feed them

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khum district, Ny is aged 28 years and married with one child. For more than ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting soybeans as primary sources of their family’s income and they can earn about KHR40,000 per day and manage to save about KHR20,000 each day for their future needs.
 
Ny has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the past loans to make her living condition better. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland, to increase her rice farming production and to grow more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Vatey

texts.en:
Vatey, who lives in the Bovel district of the Battambang province, is a mother of three dependent children. Two of her children are in school, while the other one is too young to get in school. 

Nowadays, her family’s income is generated from rice farming on five hectares of farmland and potato farming on one hectare farmland. She is working as a teacher as well. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about USD 20 per day. 

Due to lack of funds, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund in order to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor fees. She hopes to earn more money and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and labor fees

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio engages in a fish vending business. He sells fresh fish to the locals where he lives. He is a 46 year old man, with two dependent children, ages 9 and 6 year old respectively.  

He is asking for a loan to purchase varieties of fresh fish to re-sell. These will help augment his income. Thus, it will help Arsenio pay for food and other basic needs.

He dreams to expand his business, to make it productive and profitable for the welfare of his growing children.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of fresh fish

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cherry Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a retail beauty products business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. Cherry Ann is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like brushes, lipstick, and similar items for her beauty products business.

Cherry Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like brushes, lipstick, and similar items.

loans.name: Sarweri

texts.en:
Sarweri, 59 years old, runs a business selling milk with her husband. She cares for the buffalo and cows and collects the milk from them, while her husband sells it in nearby areas. 

Both Sarweri and her husband support their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures, so Sarweri  has requested this 45000 PKR loan to buy another buffalo to cater to more customers and elevate the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo to cater to more customers

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenelyn is 29 years old and has one child in school.

Jenelyn has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell like bananas, etc..

Jenelyn has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell like bananas, etc.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a 41-year-old mother of four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Liza has been running a general store in the Philippines for 20 years now. and has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell including canned goods, personal care products, home care products and other groceries

In the future, Liza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Jorge Albeiro

texts.es:
Jorge un veterano de 61 años de edad, un hombre pujante, trabajador, ambicioso, una persona muy decidida, es casado y tiene un hijo adolescente, es residente del sector de bello y se dedica al alquiler de lavadoras, una actividad que inicio por necesidad económica, se encontraba sin empleo y vio en el negocio de lavandería una oportunidad grande de generar recursos, ya que como la suya muchas familias son humildes y no cuenta con este aparato eléctrico y es más rentable para ellos alquilarlo.

Una de las claves de su exitoso es que Jorge aprendió a realizar el mantenimiento a su producto, ahorrándose el gasto de pagar a un profesional, esto le ha permitido mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por un lado porque a las lavadoras hay que estar realizando un mantenimiento periódico puesto que por el transporte y el mal uso de algunos usuarios se deterioran fácilmente.

Jorge se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de repuestos de lavadora, con su conocimiento en reparación de lavadoras junto con su alquiler hará un negocio prospero en donde los principales beneficiados sea su familia
texts.en:
Jorge is a 61-year-old veteran. He is a very strong, hard-working, ambitious, and determined person. He is married, and he has a teenage son. He is a resident of the sector of Bello, and he makes a living renting out washing machines. He started performing this work as a result of economic necessity. He was unemployed, and he saw a great opportunity to earn an income in the washing machine rental business because many families, like his, are humble and do not have this electrical appliance. For them, it is more economic to rent it.

One of the keys to his success is that Jorge learned how to perform maintenance on his machines, saving himself the expenses of paying a professional. This has allowed him to improve the conditions of his home. Indeed, his washing machines need periodic maintenance because they get damaged easily as a result of transportation and poor use by some renters. 

Jorge is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his washing machines. With his knowledge of washing machine repairs and his rentals, he will manage a thriving business from which his family will primarily benefit.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his washing machines, since he is a very skilled person who is responsible for repairing them.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old and married with five children. With four of her children in school, Christine works very hard to provide for the family.

Christine runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

Christine has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Christine would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Alejandro Quinto

texts.es:
Alejandro un hombre de 35 años de edad que vive en la unión y se dedica a realizar una de las actividades más típicas de la región la cual es la cría de aves, en su familia hay una tradición, sus antepasados mantuvieron a sus familias de esta manera y Alejandro la honra, gracias al negocio puede generar los recursos para mantener a sus 3 hijos de 10, 9 y 7 años de edad y aspira a que en algún momento, alguno de ellos pueda continuar con su linaje.

Su propósito es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, que tengan la oportunidad de realizar unos estudios bachilleratos y continuar si se puede.

Alejandro quiere solicitar para la compra de pollos y alimento, este préstamo le permitirá aumentar las ventas y clientes a partir de una mejor oferta en cantidad y dinero para ellos, espera poder tener buenas ventas y que su negocio prevalezca y crezca en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a thirty-five-year-old man, he is married and works at one of the most typical trades of the region, which is raising poultry. This is a tradition in his family, his ancestors supported their families with this work, and Alejandro continues it. Thanks to his business he earns enough income to provide for his three children, ages ten, nine, and seven, and he hopes that someday one of them will carry on the family tradition. 

His goal is to pay for his children's education, so they have the opportunity to graduate from high school and continue on if possible.

Alejandro would like to solicit a loan to buy chickens and chickenfeed. This loan will allow him to increase sales and grow his customer base with higher quantities and better prices, he hopes to have good sales so that his business grows and prospers over time.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chickenfeed

loans.name: Safilan

texts.en:
At the age of 45, Safilan deals in a business of animal sales and purchase. Her husband, also shown in the photo, assists her in buying and selling animals, along with selling their milk. She earns a good amount of income to cover her everyday expenditures. 

For the improvement of her business, Safilan has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase sales and profits.  This will provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase sales and profits and thus have a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: A 43 ans, Ayélé est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Ayélé vit dans le quartier de Tokoin et pour répondre aux besoins de la famille, Ayélé vend des sacs de sortie en se promenant dans le quartier et ses environs. Ayélé s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Ayélé nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de sortie afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ayélé is 43 years old, married and the mother of three. She lives in the Tokoin neighborhood. In order to support her family, Ayélé sells women’s handbags as an itinerant vendor in her neighborhood and nearby areas. She stocks up once a month at the market. Ayélé needs this loan to buy handbags in order to earn  a higher revenue and help pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy 45 handbags.

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en:
Gabil has cows. He has been in this business for seven years. He is married and has two children. Gabil’s elder son studies in his first year of college, his daughter is going to music school to play the piano. His lovely wife helps him on family business. They are living in Fuzuli region, but they are an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the occupied territory of Fuzuli city. 

Today, Gabil needs a loan in the amount of AZN 1,100 (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, he wants to buy hay, straw, and vaccines for his cows. Gabil is thankful for the help of the dear Kiva organization and the Kiva lenders. 

In the future, Gabil wants to repair his cow stall.

loans.use: to buy hay and vaccines for his cows.

loans.name: María Sonia

texts.es:
María de 62 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta  cuarto  grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene 4 hijos pero ya todos formaron sus propios hogares.


María se dedica a la ganadería y a la producción de cuajada, tiene alrededor de 25 años realizando dichas actividades que aprendió de sus padres, a pesar de la edad ella aún ordeña las vacas para extraer la leche y elaborar sus derivados.

Ella ayuda de este crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de granos básicos, pues se acerca la temporada y desea estar lista con su esposo.

Sus sueños son tener más ganado y seguir trabajando en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Maria is sixty-two years old, she went to school through the fourth grade. She is married, her husband has been farming for a long time. She has four children, but they all have their own households now. 

Maria raises cows and makes curd cheese, she has been doing this for around twenty-five years and was taught by her parents. In spite of her age, she still milks the cows herself and uses the milk to make derivative products. 

This loan will help her to buy the supplies to grow staple grains, since the season is approaching and she wants to be ready with her husband. 

Her dreams are to have more livestock and to continue working in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy agriculture supplies to grow staple grains

loans.name: Melik

texts.en:
Melik lives in the frontier village of Vazashen in Tavush region. Melik already has had experience of a partnership with Nor Horizon and he greatly hopes that his first loan with Kiva will be profitable and continues. 

Melik has been an electric welder for many years and he does that work by order in his village. He combines that work with farming and agriculture. He takes care of his farm with the help of his wife. 

On the farm Melik, has cows, calves, bee hives and chickens. Melik sells his farm’s milk, honey and eggs and also a great assortment of vegetables and fruits, which he cultivates on his plot of land. During the week his farm’s beans, cucumbers, greens and also fruits such as persimmons, pears, figs and apples are sold by Melik’s wife at the wholesale market. 

Melik mentions that he is happy with his occupation and he wants to start pig breeding on his farm. With this Kiva loan, he hopes to buy several piglets and also some animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and also some animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Nazish

texts.en:
At the age of 28, Nazish deals in a business of animal sales and purchase. Her brother, also shown in the photo, assists her in buying and selling goats. She earns a good amount of income to cover her everyday expenditures. 

For the improvement of her business, Nazish has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR for purchasing more goats to sell in the market at a profit.  This will provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to sell in the market at a profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more poultry to increase her business of chicken and egg production.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat has successfully built her business of selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation. She attained a good number of customers and earns a good income to contribute to the family's income. She used her prior loan to expand her business. Nusrat requested a loan for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase another cow to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
Zarrina is a young and active girl. She is 19 years old and lives with her parents and sister in Dushanbe city. She had a secondary school education. After graduation from secondary school, Zarrina started sewing. She makes a good income from her business and from the profit she can provide for her family. 
Zarrina sews more dresses and has more clients.

Now she would like to renovate her home, but does not have enough money. For this reason she applied for a loan. Zarrina hopes for your help.

loans.use: To renovate her home

loans.name: Justice B Group

texts.fr: Lukonge est commerçante, présidente de la banque communautaire «Justice B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 50 ans, mère 5 enfants dont 2 étudient et 3 sont déjà mariés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu d’une amie. Elle est vendeuse des poissons frais dans un marché de la ville depuis 35 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en cent poissons. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Lukonge is a merchant and the president of the community bank “Justice B”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is a widow, 50 years old, and the mother of five children, of whom two are students, and three are already married. Lukonge started her business with funds from a friend. She has been a vendor of fresh fish at a market in town for 35 years. She is going to stock up with a hundred fish. She would like to increase her capital and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with 100 fish

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 43 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Linda works very hard to provide for them.

Linda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Linda has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Linda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 40-year-old married woman with 3 children. She and her husband (also shown in the photo) are running a business of animal sale and purchase. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them. Her husband sells them in different markets in the city. Their business provides them with enough income to support their family. 

However, she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenses, including food, health, and clothing. Rubina requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy more baby goats to sell to expand the business, which will help to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats to sell to expand the business, which will help to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. Lorna is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her stall for her vegetable vending business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liza is 37 years old and has one child in school.

Liza has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

Liza has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Basheeran is 55 years old; she is a separated woman.  She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45,000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Afsheen

texts.en:
Afsheen is 28 years old, a married woman, and runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, and after doing sewing and embroidery, sells them to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Afsheen  has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto vive en una vereda del Carmen de vivoral es un típico campesino, su vestimenta, sus costumbres, su hogar, su profesión, tiene 68 años de edad, es un hombre viudo, no tiene familia, solo su salud e instrumentos para realizar servicios de podar el césped. 
 
Su propósito es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, vive en una casa muy vieja que pide a gritos arreglos y lo más importante para él, es tener salud para seguir trabajando y buscar un mejor beneficio.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una guadañadora, la herramienta más importante en su trabajo, de momento tiene paradas las labores y para Humberto es muy perjudicial debido a que puede perder clientes y no está recibiendo dinero.
texts.en:
Humberto, who lives on a path in Carmen del Vivoral, is a typical country person in  dress, customs, home, and his profession. He is 68 years old and a widower with no family. He only has his health and his work tools, which he uses in caring for his customers' lawns.

Humberto's two proposal are, first, to improve the condition of his home. He lives in a very old house which cries out for repairs, and the most important thing for him, is to guard his health so that he can continue working and seeking better earnings.

And second, Humberto is requesting a loan to purchase a mowing machine, the most important tool for his work. At the moment, his work has been forced to halt. This is very prejudicial for Humberto because he could lose customers and is currently without income.

loans.use: , a widower from the countryside, to purchase a mowing machine in order to renew offering his lawn care services, and, also, to repair his home.

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is 44 years old, a married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Mukhtaran  makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use  to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Mukhtaran wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing a good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melba is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Melba has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL EN UN PERSONA MUY RESPONSABLE QUE CON ESFUERZO Y DEDICACIÓN HA LOGRADO TENER UN BUEN TRABAJO, ACTUALMENTE PRESENTA PROBLEMAS DENTALES QUE LE HAN IMPEDIDO ASISTIR A LABORAR EN LOS ÚLTIMOS DÍAS. EL NECESITA UN TRATAMIENTO PARA ALIVIAR SUS MOLESTIAS.
texts.en:
This borrower is a responsible individual who has been able to secure a good job because of his effort and dedication. He currently suffers from dental problems that have prevented him from being at work in recent days.

He is in need of treatment in order to alleviate his discomfort.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Josephine, 39 years old, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management.

Josephine is involved in the business of buying and selling avocados. She is applying for a Kiva loan to buy more avocados so as to add stock to her avocados supply business, hence to earn more income. This will enable her pay for construction of modern housing and access to better health care for her family. 

She is grateful to Kiva and the lenders, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more avocados to add stock to earn more income to pay for construction of a modern housing and access to better health care for her family.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem has successfully built her business of milk selling with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By now, she has she attained a good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously with the help of a Kiva loan, she was able to expand her business. Currently she applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase another cow to increase her sales and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales and gain more profits.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years.  She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Perveen's embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of four children. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR,  to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time. This will allow her to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time

loans.name: Rudik

texts.en:
Rudik lives in Tsaghkunk village in Gegharkunik region. He is a farmer, who combines his work also with the work of builder and seasonal work in the Russian Federation. 

While he is in his native village, he takes care of his farm cattle: cows, heifers, calves, sheep, a horse and lambs. On his plot of land, he cultivates potatoes and wheat for sale. 

Rudik has a big family and he lives with his wife, two children and his parents, who are retired and old and in very rare cases, they manage to help their son about the farm. Rudik’s wife tries to help her husband with the sale of their farm products, such as milk, macun (a national dairy-product), cheese and also meat. 

Farming brings a constant income to his family and also good, fresh products for his family's use. Rudik is worried since he is a little bit late in his agricultural work, as he has a lack of money. This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams, Rudik will use for the purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela is 34 years old and she lives in Gavar city of the Gegharkunik region. Anzhela graduated from agricultural college, and as she mentions with a smile, she has worked at her specialty since the time she got married. With her husband, for many years they have taken care of their farm cattle. 

She also cultivates vegetables on her plot of land. She has cows and calves on her farm, and she manages to have a lot of milk and meat for sale. Anzhela sells locally her land’s potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes and greens. For all her farm products, she finds customers herself and tries to sell all of it since farming is the only source of income by which she takes care of her six children, who are all minors. 

This loan of 300,000 Armenian drams Anzhela asks for buying animal fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Luchie

texts.en:
Luchie is a woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luchie is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Luchie has a farming vegetable business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Luchie has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Luchie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 32 years old with three children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

She has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Bharawan

texts.en:
Bharawan is 29 years old, a married woman and mother of 5 children.  She is a hardworking mother, who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  

She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue the operation of her business, she requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy stitching materials, such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material, such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Githima Gichiengo Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Winnie; she is 40 years old, married, and a mother of three children.  She is a member of Githima Gichiengo SHG Group that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development and financial management.

She is a vegetable farmer and is borrowing to buy fertilizer and quality seeds to enable her increase vegetable production for increased sales.  She will then be able to earn more income, which will help pay for her family's daily expenses with ease.

Winnie is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and quality seeds to enable her to increase vegetable production for increased sales.

loans.name: Muniran

texts.en:
Muniran is 48, a married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years, and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo. This will allow her to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia  is 25 years old, a married woman. She has four children. Asia  is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her  to purchase more beads, thread, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit. 

This monetary help can take Asia closer to her dream of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, thread, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit.

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon, the gentleman appearing in the photo, is 37 years old and a single parent to one child. Zablon’s economic activity is clothes selling. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in July, 2013, and has received training on enterprise development and financial planning which have equipped him with skills to effectively manage his enterprise. 

He is borrowing a Kiva loan to add more second hand clothing stock to his enterprise. 

He hopes the loan will help him boost his business, hence increase his income. He will therefore be able to support his family and improve their overall living standards. 

Zablon is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of second hand clothes that will help boost sales.

loans.name: Yorleidi Paola

texts.es:
La historia de Yorleides es impactante ella una mujer de 23 años de edad que fue madre a los 16 años, ser madre tan prematuramente le corto muchas alas, tuvo que salirse del estudio, buscar cómo generar recursos ya que su padre era igual de joven, pero se amaban y contrajeron matrimonio y tenían pensando vivir una vida juntos, al tiempo en que vivió con el marido iniciaron las diferencias con él, el resultado final fue que se separó, quedando como madre cabeza de familia de un hijo de 7 años de edad y otro con 9 meses.

Ella se encargaba de las labores del hogar principalmente, pero ahora tiene una buena idea que le podría significar el ingreso que necesita para solventar sus necesidades económicas.

Quiere montar en su vereda un negocio de café internet por lo que necesita un préstamo para la compra de unos equipos y conexión de una red inalámbrica de 10g de navegación compartida para inicialmente tres equipos.
texts.en:
The story of Yorleides is impactful.  This 23 year old woman became a mother at the age of sixteen.  Becoming a mother so prematurely cut off many opportunities.  She had to leave school and find a way to earn a living.  The child's father was just as young, but they loved each other and got married, planning to live their lives together.  After living together they began to have differences and they separated, leaving Yorleides as the head of the family with a seven year old and a nine month old child.  

She had been in charge of the household tasks but then she had a good idea that would help her increase income that she needed to cover her economic needs.

She wants to open an internet café on her street.  This is why she needs a loan, in order to purchase the equipment and wireless network with 10g of navigation to be shared by three stations initially.

loans.use: to start an internet café.  It will pay for the connection and three stations.

loans.name: Maqsoodan

texts.en:
Maqsoodan is 36 years old, a married woman and mother of 4 children. She is working hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.  She, with her husband, is doing work in agriculture for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds, with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, Maqsoodan has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, with the packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Martha Aydee

texts.es: Martha de 57 años de edad,  desde la comodidad de su hogar ofrece en su almacén misceláneo artículos de papelería, detalles para toda ocasión, golosinas y caramelos. Esta habitante del municipio de Soledad en el Atlántico,  inició su negocio por la necesidad de generar ingresos y ser autosostenible, con nueve años de experiencia en éste formato de negocio, ella genera sus compras de contado en almacenes ubicados en el centro de Barranquilla, donde le ofrecen precios de oportunidad en sus compras, así mismo ella ofrece sus productos con facilidades de pago o de contado según el cliente lo prefiera.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en artículos de papelería, golosinas y detalles para toda ocasión.  Ella considera que esta inversión incrementará las ventas y con ello las ganancias.  Martha es madre de un hijo de 30 años y una hija de 24 años. Ella es muy comprometida con su negocio el cual abre desde las 6 a.m. y cierra a las 10 p.m. diariamente, su meta a largo plazo es fortalecer el capital del negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Martha is 57 years old. From the comfort of her house she offers from her notions store, paper goods, gifts for all occasions, sweets and caramels. This inhabitant of the municipality of Soledad, Atlántico, started her business out of the necessity of generating income and becoming self-sustaining.

With 9 years of experience in the business she buys her goods in cash at warehouses located in the center of Barranquilla, where she gets advantageous prices on her purchases. She offers her products on credit or in cash according to the customer's preference.

She is currently requesting a loan from Kiva the first loan she has had through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will invest in paper goods, sweets and gifts for all occasions. She believes this investment will increase her sales and with that her profits.

Martha is the mother of a 30 year old son and a 24 year old daughter. She is very dedicated to her business which she opens at 6 am and closes at 10 pm daily. Her long term goal is to strengthen her business capital to improve her income.

loans.use: to invest in paper goods, sweets and gifts for all occasions.

loans.name: Lugazi Homestone School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Godfrey. He is the Headteacher of Lugazi Homestone School, a mixed school in the urban area of Lugazi with 700 students. 

Lugazi Homestone School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank and pump, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Lugazi Homestone School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. 

Godfrey ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 47 years old, married, and living with her husband and the six children she is blessed with. She does poultry farming and also sells second hand clothes. 

She is borrowing a loan to buy poultry feed so that she can improve her proceeds and also boost her second hand clothes business.

She hopes that this will improve on her sales, which will increase her income thus providing for the family needs with ease.

Lucy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and more stock of second hand clothes that will boost income.

loans.name: Kyati Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photograph is Regina, 52 years old with three children and two dependants. She joined HiH EA in year 2014 to benefit from the savings mobilization and enterprise development training. 

Regina practices dairy farming, and she is borrowing to buy dairy feed which will enable her to increase milk production and earn more income.  She will therefore be able to cater for her family's daily expenses.

She is grateful to Kiva and the lenders, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed which will enable her to increase milk production and earn more income.

loans.name: Kibuu Welfare Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Justrina, a member of Kibuu Welfare Group in Thika Kenya. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children.

She operates a shop to earn a living; it has been in operation for the last five years.Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, she has acquired skills on enterprise development, financial management, savings and resource mobilization. 

Justrina is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more stock of foodstuffs for her shop.This will lead to more sales hence more income. She will thus be in a position to cater for family needs such as food, clothing and shelter.

Justrina is grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of foodstuffs for the shop thus gain more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a polisher, a drill, metallic material, paint etc.  Without these tools he cannot complete his work.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. She is living in the area where agriculture is the most common business to do. She is married and has two children. She has land where she plants berries and sells the harvest in the domestic market. The last harvest was good, but the earned money from this was not enough for her family's needs. 

She decided to process her land and now plant vegetables, like onions. She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to process her land and then to plant vegetables. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemical to process her land in order to plant vegetables

loans.name: Lorencia School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Irene. She is the Supervisor of Lorencia Junior School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Nsangi with 400 students. 

Lorencia Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Lorencia Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Irene ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for school students.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marife is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marife has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marife requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marife has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Joseline is a group leader, aged 47. She is married with four children aged between 13 and 18 years; they all go to school.

The group is called “Abisunganye”, which means “Altogether” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses to change their futures for the better.

Joseline sells foodstuffs and has been doing this business for the past six years, while her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and beans to sell.

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and beans to sell.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 32 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to be trained in savings mobilization and enterprise development.

She is involved in a clothes selling business. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more clothes and add more stock to her clothes selling business. She hopes that the loan will help her increase the sales and thus earn more income to enable her to meet her family's daily expenses. 

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add more stock to her clothes selling business for increased income to meet her family's daily expenses.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is 30 years old, a married woman and mother of 3 children. She and her husband have been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. 

Sughran fully supports and assists her husband with his work. Now, she has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: St. John's High School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Robert.He is the Headteacher of St.John's High School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Mukono with 800 students. 

St. John's School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. John's School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Robert ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is married and has three children; all of them are going to school. Adela makes and sells cheese. She sells her products at Achacachi.

Adela has her own house, and her husband drives a tractor so he provides services to all the farmers of the community.

Adela needs a loan to buy a milking cow. She and her husband are having a lot of expenses at their home; that is why Adela is asking for help.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana, her husband, their son and parents-in-law live in Panik village of Shirak region. Liana runs a small store where she sells a large variety of food and drink products. 

In addition to that business, Liana and her husband are also involved in farming business. Together they cultivate potatoes, carrots and garlic, and also keep cows, calves and hens. All resources are used to cover family's daily basic needs, and nothing remains to invest in the farming business to develop it. That's the reason Liana asks lenders for this loan. She plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer and to cover other cultivation costs. 

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Liana's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer and to cover other cultivation costs

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a farmer and lives in his native village, Geghamavan, of Gegharkunik region. Artur’s wife is unemployed, and she takes care of their two children.

Artur owns a farm where he keeps a cow, a calf, a pig, sheep, and chickens. He also cultivates potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, and greens on his land, the sale of which he manages with his wife. His farm’s milk, meat, and eggs are not enough for sale, so these go mainly for his family’s use.

Artur’s main income from his land is especially from the sale of potatoes. He is asking for this loan of 120,000 Armenian drams for buying potato seedlings and also fertilizer for his land.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and also fertilizer for his land.

loans.name: Kijiko Ushindi Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photograph is Mary, a member of Kijiko Ushindi Women Group. She is 50 years old, married, and a mother of 4 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from the training, especially in enterprise development and financial management.

She keeps sheep to sell as her economic activity. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy quality fodder for her sheep, which will enable her sheep to be healthy and therefore produce quality mutton for increased income.  She will then be able to pay school fees for her children.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy quality fodder for her sheep which will enable her sheep to be healthy and therefore produce quality mutton for increased income.

loans.name: Akzholtoi

texts.ru: Акжолтой, 56 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Акжолтой- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Акжолтой занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Акжолтой, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 3 лошади, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Акжолтой обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строй материалов для завершения строительства сарая для скота. Доходы от бизнеса Акжолтой планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Akzholtoi is 56 years old and married. She and her husband are raising four children. Akzholtoi has a secondary education. For the family's main income, Akzholtoi rears animals and grows crops, having started 20 years ago by buying livestock with 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today Akzholtoi has three cows, three horses, and fifteen sheep. The monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Akzholtoi  has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy construction materials to finish building a livestock barn. Akzholtoi plans to invest the income from the business in increasing her number of domesticated livestock.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
