Mona is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman with four children. Her husband is the main income provider in the family; he works in a company. 

Due to their difficult financial status, Mona decided to start her own job from home. She is a talented tailor, having worked in this type of business for the past nine years. She produces different clothing designs and does repairs as well.

Today, in order to improve her work, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase tailoring products. Mona is a very optimistic person and aims always to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring products

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 22-year-old single woman living with her parents and three siblings. Her father is the main source of income for the family. 

As for Samah, she has been working as an assistant in a medical clinic since 2011, and earns a barely sufficient income. For this reason she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l, to be able to pay her university education fees. 

Samah is very eager to make good use of the loan as her only purpose is to get an education so she can be competitive with others and reach higher positions in her professional career.

loans.use: to pay her university education fees

loans.name: Concepter

texts.en:
Concepter is 30 years old, married to Geoffrey, and she supports six family members. She has been a farmer for the last eight years, and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 11,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to purchase fertilizers and insecticides so as to get a better harvest and meet the needs of clients.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides so as to get a better harvest and meet the needs of clients.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is 55 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is still in school. Nenita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Nenita has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is 31 years old and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Rowena has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Nerlyn

texts.en:
Nerlyn is 46 years old and has one child. She is married and has one child still in school. Nerlyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetable in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seeds, sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Nerlyn has been on this business for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Voskehat

texts.en:
Voskehat, with her husband and two school-age children, lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. 

Voskehat has a small farm with several cows, calves, sheep, and chickens. The farm products that she sells are not great: milk, macun (national dairy-product), meat, and eggs. She also has a nice orchard where she planted apple, plum, and peach trees. She also sells grapes to the wine making factory. In all these, potato cultivation is the most profitable for her family. All the harvest she sells mainly to re-sellers.  

Voskehat with her husband do their best to improve their family's living conditions, since now it is very hard even to cover their everyday needs. Voskehat hopes that this loan, which she wants to use on the purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer, and diesel fuel for her land, will give her a good harvest of potatoes for the coming season, and also that she will be able to buy animal fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to purchase potato seedlings, fertilizer, and diesel fuel for her land and to buy animal fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Tatevik

texts.en:
Tatevik is a widow and she lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region with her elder daughter, who is divorced, and two grandchildren. 

Tatevik graduated from trading college and for several years she worked as a saleswoman at the shoe department. Now she works at Kapan city’s poultry factory as a worker. Tatevik and her daughter are doing their best to provide better living conditions for the children, but for Tatevik it is a hard period as she has some health problems. She will use this loan of 230,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to solve her health problems. 

She thanks Kiva lenders in advance and hopes to be supported by them.

loans.use: to solve her health problems

loans.name: Israyel

texts.en:
Israyel is from Arevshat village where he lives with his wife, two sons and daughter-in-law. He is farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past years. Israyel grows wheat, potatoes and carrots and also keep three cows and calves. 

Israyel owns a truck which he uses in transporting the harvest to the bazaar to sell. Besides his own harvest, Israyel also collects products from nearby villages and transports it to the bazaar with his truck. Now, by applying for this loan, Israyel asks lenders to help him to purchase seeds, fertilizer for land cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock. 

Because the region where Israyel's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Israyel's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer for land cultivation, and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Vardush

texts.en:
Vardush is a farmer. She lives in Aratashen village, with her husband and 18-year-old son. Besides farming, Vardush also works at a local bakery. She works hard to manage her work and help her husband to earn income for living.

Their farm includes a calf and 50 hens. They also organize cultivation of potato, cabbage, tomato, cucumber and pepper, in the greenhouse. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Vardush's family usually sells their harvest in a local, regional market.

To be able to improve the farm and enlarge it, Vardush has applied for this loan. She needs to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and fertilizer, and to hire workers for land cultivation. This is Vardush's second loan. She obtained a previous loan from a local financial institution. Unfortunately, that first loan was very difficult for her to pay back, and Vardush faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during more recent times, she and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, Vardush has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. This second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and fertilizer, and to hire workers for land cultivation.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar is a bright woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1995. She is living in a small city with her family. Nilufar is single and recently started studies at a university. She is a second year student.

Her mother advised her to appeal to IMON for support. Nilufar studies with excellence and is active in her classes. She is well known among friends and students. She is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to pay for her educational costs. She hopes to be supported, graduate from her university, and be a specialist in her major.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs.
